Job Description: Architectural Sales ManagerCGC Inc. is a leading marketer, manufacturer and distributor of gypsum wallboard products, interior finishing material and suspended acoustical ceilings. With locations around the world, CGC and USG have the resources, plants, products, and people to build walls, ceilings, and careers.CGC Inc. is currently recruiting an Architectural Sales Manager for our corporate Ceilings Sales Department, based in Oakville, ON; Montreal, QC; Calgary, AB; or Vancouver, BC.It's a permanent and full-time position, offering a challenging opportunity for a motivated individual to demonstrate their sales and technical abilities within a large corporation.Position SummaryThis position has overall responsibility for managing the CGC relationship with the Architectural and General Contractor community in Canada. Manages and develops Architectural Sales Representatives, training them in their current assignment and preparing them for future promotional opportunities and changing market conditions. The position will collaborate with the Gypsum & Ceilings sales organizations to determine the best allocation of architectural support between the two organizations.Key Duties and Responsibilities· Hire, retain, manage, coach, and develop assigned Architecture Sales Representatives.· Monitor conversion and inclusion of specifications and track major projects.· Coordinate resource allocation of architecture and general contractor support between Architectural, Ceilings and Gypsum Division.· Maintain high level relationships at key members of the construction team, including owner representatives, architects, general contractors, construction managers, subcontractors and distributors.· Implement and lead sales strategies to attain specification parity with competition.Business and Market Knowledge· Fully understands CGC and USG’s critical challenges and leads the effort to address them while leveraging CGC and USG’s competitive strengths.· Leverages a broad array of company and industry informational resources to address key business issues.· Accurately summarizes business and financial data, and consistently applies that information.· Chooses the course of action that targets the most critical issues and has the greatest impact on the business.· Takes clear and decisive action in high-stakes situations and crisis, and conditions of uncertainty.· Creates a climate supportive of candid communication and collaboration.· Proactively solicits diverse perspectives and leverages them to build best practices.· Attends to and demonstrates understanding of key pieces of complex spoken information, extracts relevant information from presentations on highly complicated topics.· Accurately anticipates customer needs and proactively meets/exceeds expectations and requirements of external and internal customers.· Promotes the rules of ethical conduct in interactions with others, follows through on commitments.Qualifications:· Demonstrated leadership and organizational skills.· Results oriented, proven track record of data driven success.· Strong interpersonal and communication skills· Experience within the building materials/architectural/construction community.Education· Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field.Years of Experience· Five (5) to ten (10) years of functional experience in Management, Sales, or similar functional area.Required Skills· Good understanding of customer dynamics in the Architectural or Construction community· Able to work through ambiguity.· Cross-functional understanding of CGC and USG businesses and functions.· Experience as a People Leader.· Participation in cross functional task forces or teams.What We OfferCGC offers competitive base salaries and cash incentive awards, comprehensive benefits, and financial protection for employees and their families. Our Employee Group Benefits Plan (extended health care and dental care) begins on your first day of work!· Extended health care (including prescription drugs, vision, and paramedical professional services)· Dental care (includes both preventative care and major dental work)· Short-term and long-term disability· Life insurance· Retirement plan- contributory defined benefit plan· Investment plan- defined contribution plan with options to contribute to a Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) and/or a non-registered savings plan.· Incentive Plan- cash payments based on target achievement are earned quarterly or annually, depending upon the plan.· Vacation time- between four and seven weeks paid vacation based on length of continuous service.· Employee Assistance Program (EAP)· Wellness Program offers fitness club memberships at a special reduced rate, health coaching, nutrition support, smoking cessation services, and much more.· Rewards and Recognition ProgramWe understand the importance of balancing work and your personal life and will help you make your best contribution in both.At CGC Inc. we go the distance to provide The Better Way. Delivering building solutions for customers worldwide is our goal. Relationships are our foundation. Integrity, Dependability, and Innovation are the standards by which we live.CGC Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting diversity of thought, ideas, perspective, and people. We create an inclusive environment that attracts, retains and values people of all backgrounds by treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence through inclusion, integration, and equal opportunity. We are committed to meeting the needs of those who interact with CGC, Inc. in accordance with Federal and provincial laws. Information regarding applicant accessibility may be found on the Accessibility section of our website.

Architectural Sales Representative - Aluminum Building Materials (Cladding).Job Title: Architectural Sales Representative - Aluminum Building Materials (Cladding).Location: Aurora, Ontario.Company Overview: Alumax Panel, a leading Canadian entity in the domain of Aluminum Architectural Cladding Solutions, is seeking a dynamic Architectural Sales Representative to join our team. With a strong commitment to R&D and a collaboration with an S&P 500 American company, we are at the forefront of innovative cladding solutions. Our flagship product, Altalyte, is setting new benchmarks in the industry for fire protection and sustainability.Job Summary: As an Architectural Sales Representative, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our presence in the market, focusing on architects, developers, ACM fabricators, and installers. You will be the driving force behind introducing our groundbreaking product, Altalyte, and other aluminum decorative materials to these key sectors.Key ResponsibilitiesGenerate new leads and manage existing accounts to grow Alumax Panel’s market share.Provide technical presentations and product demonstrations to architects and developers.Organize and conduct 'Lunch and Learn' sessions to educate clients about our products.Attend industry events, fostering relationships and enhancing brand visibility.Deliver insights and strategies for presenting our materials effectively in the market.Collaborate with internal teams to align sales strategies with company goals.Contribute to continuous improvement by providing feedback from field experiences.QualificationsProven sales experience in the building materials industry.Strong technical knowledge of cladding materials.Established relationships with architects, builders, and related industry professionals.Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Willingness to travel as required.Performance MetricsSuccess in this role will be measured through a variety of metrics including client meetings scheduled, new prospect development, and contribution to quarterly sales targets.Our expectation is a proactive approach to market engagement and a consistent drive for business development.What We OfferA competitive salary with performance-based incentives.Opportunities for professional growth and development within a dynamic and innovative company.A collaborative and supportive work environment.Application Process: Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter detailing their experience and suitability for the role.About Alumax Panel Inc.Alumax Panel has a rich history of experience in the construction industry and has been involved in the development of many commercial properties, both interior and exterior -. We not only supply materials but have facilitated and developed custom fabrication based on our client’s needs. We provide full end-to-end services that include, aluminum product supply, consultation and design, customization and fabrication, and product Installation. We pride ourselves on being pioneers in the supply, design, fabrication, installation and implementation of modern designs using aluminum composite panels in custom-made homes, and large-scale residential and commercial buildings.

Site Assessment: Conduct site visits to evaluate existing conditions and gather essential information. Detailed Visualization: Utilize CAD software like Revit and 3ds Max to produce detailed drawings, models, and renderings. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure adherence to building codes, regulations, and zoning laws. Construction Support: Provide guidance and support during the construction phase to maintain alignment with design intent. Proficiency in different software including CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit), Sketchup, Adobe Creative Suite, and other related software. Knowledge of appropriate legislation including Occupational Health & Safety Act and Employment Standards Above average technology skills (Outlook, MS Word, Excel, Project Management software, Text, Email) Excellent verbal and written communication skills, which are important in performing many of their duties, such as relaying information, preparing reports, and interacting with members of the organization. Able to collaborate appropriately with build-team members and management. Able to act with integrity, credibility, self-confidence, take initiative, be self-directed, and prioritize work. This is not a hybrid or remote position. Position OverviewConstruction Ontario trains with the future in mind. We deliver supportive and innovative recruitment solutions for small, medium, and large construction employers. In addition, we help Ontarians find jobs in construction with diverse companies across Ontario.Our member is seeking a highly organized and experienced Custom Home Project Manager to join their dynamic team. As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire lifecycle of custom home builds, from initial client consultation to project completion. Collaborating closely with an Assistant Supervisor, you will play a crucial role in coordinating trades, managing schedules, and ensuring the successful execution of high-quality custom home projects.Key ResponsibilitiesClient Interaction:Conduct initial client consultations to understand their vision, preferences, and specific requirements.Establish and maintain strong client relationships throughout the project, providing regular updates and addressing concerns or inquiries promptly.Project Planning:Develop comprehensive project plans outlining timelines, milestones, and critical path activities.Collaborate with the design team to ensure accurate interpretation and implementation of client specifications.Budgeting and Pricing:Gather pricing information from suppliers, subcontractors, and other relevant sources to develop accurate project cost estimates.Monitor and manage project budgets, identifying and addressing any cost overruns.Trade Coordination:Collaborate with subcontractors and trade professionals to ensure seamless coordination of work.Negotiate contracts and agreements with subcontractors, ensuring competitive pricing and adherence to project timelines.Scheduling and Logistics:Develop and maintain a detailed project schedule, coordinating activities and resources efficiently.Oversee logistics, including material deliveries, equipment rentals, and site preparations.Quality Control:Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the highest standards of workmanship.Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress and address any issues promptly.Team Leadership:Work closely with the Assistant Supervisor to delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively.Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to team members, fostering a collaborative and results-driven work environment. Qualifications:Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management, specifically in custom home building.Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering high-quality custom home projects on time and within budget.Strong knowledge of construction processes, building codes, and industry best practices.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, subcontractors, and team members.Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills.Proficient in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite.If you are a motivated and experienced Custom Home Project Manager with a passion for delivering exceptional results, we invite you to apply and contribute to our partner’s growing success in the custom home building industry.

Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. QualificationsDiplôme universitaire ou DEC en design d’intérieurMinimum de 2 ans d’expériencesMembre de l’APDIQMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)Maîtrise du logiciel Autodesk Revit®, suite Microsoft Office et Enscape3DConnaissances du cadre législatif et réglementaire en matière de construction (ex. : CCQ, CNBC)Formation ou accréditation LEED ou WELLÊtre méthodique et soucieux de la qualité du travailFaire preuve d’autonomie, de polyvalence et de créativitéEsprit ouvert, positif et collaboratif Informations complémentairesContribuer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et attentionnée. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Notre culture et ADN sauront vous exprimer la reconnaissance de votre travail, vos talents et vos compétencesPoste permanents : 36h présence/télétravail avec horaire flexible. Salaire concurrentiel et vacances bonifiéesProgramme de formation continue et soutien au développement de carrièreProgramme de remboursement de la cotisation professionnelleÉquipements technologiques fournisActivités sociales, sportives, de santé ou bien êtreLieu de travail ; Laval - quartier Duvernay avec stationnement, verdure et espace détente extérieure : près du Parc de la nature, d’une garderie, d’une pâtisserie et d’autres services de quartier.

Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. And while they’re here, employees can take advantage of many opportunities: In-house training, and training at other institutions, for courses related to employees’ current positions or to prepare them for advancement within BC Housing.  Wellness programs including physical fitness, programs to help employees quit smoking, free flu shots, mental health resources, and lunch-and-learn lectures and seminars.  Recognition programs including long-term service awards, idea recognition and outstanding performance awards.  Livegreen incentives include an employee transit pass program, and other initiatives that encourage alternative, sustainable transportation (even a bike purchase program!).  An active Social Club that organizes special events like seasonal parties and arranges group discounts to other events.  Participation in community and charitable events. ** Please note: Eligibility for benefits offered is based on employment status **TENANT SUPPORT WORKER:($56,796.64 - $65,740.30 Annually)Position SummaryReporting to the assigned supervisor, the Tenant Support Worker works with tenants to provide emotional support, develop skills and access resources to increase their capacity to be successful and satisfied in the living, working, learning, and/or social environments of their choice. He/she/they provides these services directly or facilitates and coordinates access to services available on the site and in the community. The position establishes positive working relationships with a diverse tenant population from various socioeconomic backgrounds and supports with overcoming challenges living in a social housing environment. The role also works with various internal teams and external community partners to resolve potential issues, coordinate opportunities, and facilitate changes that increase the chances of successful tenancies.CANDIDATE PROFILEThe successful candidate will have the following:EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Diploma in community social service, health care delivery, community mental health, or other relevant fields.  Considerable experience in direct supportive counselling with diverse populations that face multiple barriers to successful housing.  Or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience acceptable to the employer. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Sound knowledge of current social issues such as poverty, homelessness, mental illness, addictions, domestic violence, child protection, etc.  Sound knowledge of community resources and methods of access.  Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act and applicable Health and Safety regulations.  Ability to learn and understand BC Housing and social housing programs, and their role in the social service system.  Ability to learn and understand BC Housing programs, policies, and operational structure.  Ability to apply a high degree of discretion in establishing supportive, trusting relationships with tenants while respecting the role and obligations of property management staff according to the Residential Tenancy Act.  Ability to build relationships with internal and external clients.  Ability to assist groups to develop and co-ordinate community activities and programs.  Ability to build and maintain professional, confidential relationships with multi-barriered people.  Ability to work effectively across organizational departments and in a team and partnership context.  Strong analytical, problem-solving, and time management skills.  Strong awareness of cultural diversity.  Strong skills in crisis intervention, mediation, and conflict resolution.  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and basic computer systems  Valid Class 5 BC driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle  Please Note: Successful applicant(s) are subject to a satisfactory criminal record search and are required to maintain Security Clearance throughout their employment.  Due to the nature of this role, a valid class 5 driver's license and satisfactory driving record is required. Company:    Southbridge Health Care LPLocation:     Ontario Region (Head Office - Cambridge)Position:      Project Manager – Permanent Full-timePosition DescriptionSouthbridge is looking for an experienced Project Manager for long-term care redevelopment and Capex projects. The successful candidate must possess the knowledge, experience, and confidence to engage and professionally interact with design professionals and consultants, while successfully directing construction related personnel in planning, coordinating and safely executing work in accordance with contract documents, schedule and budget. Opportunities will include managing all aspects of Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care, municipal and code approvals. You will also manage schedules, budgets, design, drawings and specifications for each project.ResponsibilitiesThe Project Manager performs a wide range of duties including but not limited to all the following:Define the scope of the project in collaboration with the Vice President of Development Create a detailed work plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project Determine resources required to complete the project Develop a schedule for project completion that effectively allocates resources to activities Review project schedule with senior management and all other staff that will be affected by the project activities; revise the schedule as required Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion Work with internal team and hired designers/consultants to establish initial design, specification accuracy, drawing and tender accuracy Assess and contract qualified consultants and engineers to work on the project as appropriate Execute the project according to the project plan Document project activities Monitor the progress of the project and adjust as necessary to ensure successful completion on time and on budget Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets Southbridge standards Write reports on the project for management Monitor and approve all budgeted project expenditures Manage all project funds according to established accounting policies and procedures Ensure that all financial records for the project are up to date Ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase QualificationsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesKnowledge of project management methodology and tools Proficiency in the use of software for scheduling, budgeting, MS Office Personal characteristicsThe successful candidate should be able to demonstrate competence in all of the following:Behave Ethically: Understand ethical behavior and business practices, and ensure that own behavior and the behavior of others is consistent with these standards and aligns with the values of Southbridge. Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques. Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the project and to create new opportunities. Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness. Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of Southbridge. Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of Southbridge. Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals and track details/data/information/activities. Plan: Determine strategies to move the project forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans and evaluate the process and results. Solve Problems: Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem. Experience5 to 10 years in project management construction, planning and management experience Working ConditionsProject Managers usually work in an office environment, but the purpose of the project may sometimes take them to non-standard workplaces including travel for regularly scheduled site meetings. Project Managers work a standard work week but may be required to work some evenings and weekends to meet project milestones. We know that diversity underpins excellence, and that we all share responsibility for creating an equitable, diverse and inclusive Board-community.Therefore, in pursuit of the Board’s values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across the organizational hierarchy in actualizing the Board’s priorities, goals and principles outlined in the Director’s Action Plan. Candidates who have strong racial literacy practices and a commitment to dismantling anti-racism, anti-oppression, and creating identity-affirming spaces, in order to intentionally disrupt racist and hateful acts.We Actively Encourage Applications From Members Of Groups With Historical And/or Current Barriers To Sovereignty, Equity, Including, But Not Limited ToFirst Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples, and all other Indigenous peoples;African, Black and Black Caribbean peoples (in alignment with Anti-Black Racism Strategy);South Asian, East Asian, Southeast Asian, Middle East/West Asian, Latino/Hispanic (in alignment with YRDSB Workforce Census to address disproportionalities identified).members of groups that commonly experience discrimination due to race, ancestry, colour, religion and/or spiritual beliefs, or place of origin;persons with visible and/or invisible (physical and/or mental) disabilities;persons who identify as women; andpersons of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities, and gender expressions.At YRDSB, we recognize that many of these identities intersect and therefore, equity, diversity and inclusion can be complex. We value and respect the contributions that each person brings to enriching the Board and are committed to ensuring full and equal participation for all in the communities that we serve.Accessibility and Accommodation StatementWe also recognize the duty to accommodate and foster a culture of inclusion. Consistent with the principles of dignity, individualization and inclusion, we will make any appropriate accommodation based on any of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code to support candidate participation in the hiring process. When contacted, candidates will be provided with an overview of the various elements of the hiring process, such as skills assessments, written practicum, presentation, interview, etc. If an accommodation is required, requests can be made in advance of any stage of the recruitment process. All information received relating to a candidate’s required accommodation will be addressed confidentially by the Recruitment and Retention Team. Please make this request to careers@yrdsb.ca or a member of the Recruitment Team. If this position is a school based LTO/Contract Teaching position, please email the Principal directly to request the accommodation to be made at the school in collaboration with Human Resource Services, Disability Management Team.Important Note for YRDSB Employees: If you have a current accommodation in place through Disability Management, please inform your Disability Management Case Manager to ensure that your accommodation needs can be met in the new role that you are pursuing. If invited to participate in the hiring process, and you are unable to perform the essential/bona fide requirements (e.g. physical, cognitive requirements), please notify the Recruitment Team by emailing careers@yrdsb.ca to review next steps (in the email please reference the job title you are applying to).Important Information For CUPE 1734 MembersLA.11.7 Those twelve (12) month employees filling vacancies as a result of their applying to a job posting are to remain twelve (12) months at their position. Ten (10) month employees are to remain in their position until the end of the school year. This requirement can be waived with permission from the Superintendent responsible for Human Resource Services. This does not prevent employees from applying for a position or from applying for a promotion during the twelve (12) month period.On-line applications are collected centrally at the Education Centre - Aurora and are monitored by Human Resource Services. All applications will be screened based on the required education, experience and qualifications as noted in the posting and job description and as reflected in the application. Only those candidates meeting these criteria will be eligible to participate in the selection process and only qualified candidates will be contacted.The personnel file of all internal applicants will be reviewed as part of the selection process.

Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Location: 7120 Hurontario St., MississaugaHours of Work: 35 hours per weekWho we are: Peel Housing Corporation provides safe, well maintained living environments for tenants in Peel Living and Region of Peel owned properties including: 71 residential properties, two transitional housing residences and three emergency shelters. These services contribute to a positive experience for residents and enhance neighbourhoods where the buildings are located.In this role you will be responsible for supporting execution of projects for common area and in-suite renovation and other state of good repair related Capital Works within the Peel Living portfolio. As a member of the Peel Housing Corporation (O/A Peel Living) Infrastructure and Planning Services team. As the Specialist, you will provide technical expertise/guidance and oversee work including supporting the Project Manager in execution of projects, design development, specification and standards development, contract administration and construction inspection.What You Will Do In This RoleTechnical, Design and Specification preparation and Construction Inspection: Develops design concepts and associated presentation materials based on research & resolution of technical/ design issues.  Develops construction documents for projects of varying scope with minimal supervision.  Modifies and update designs based on review comments from senior staff.  Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work.  Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules.  Preparation of contract documents / scoping and integration with Engineering drawings as necessary.  Supports execution of technical design assignments in a timely manner.  Supports Senior staff with effective analysis of applicable building codes, by-laws and other regulations and technical documents / reports to which a project may be subject.  Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. What The Role Requires Post-secondary diploma/degree/certificate in an architectural or design program or a combination of education and experience may be considered  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the fields of Interior Design, Architecture, or construction and working with various building trades, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.  Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. Nice To Have Ability to become OAA member/licensed Architect or Technologist or a Registered Interior designer with ARIDO would be considered an asset.  National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. Perks @ Peel and why you will love working for us: Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision benefit plan including psychological health (effective start date)  Automatic enrolment into OMERS pension plan (where applicable)  Accrue Vacation on a monthly basis (where applicable) up to 3 weeks per annum  3 Paid personal days and floating holidays  Flexible hours supporting your wellness and wellbeing  Annual performance review and merit increases based on performance (where applicable)  Supportive leadership and a culture of respect and inclusion  Access to tuition reimbursement (where applicable) and learning and development resources Work Mode & Job Location:  In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario St., Mississaugaworksite. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario. The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.  Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.Kindly ensure to regularly monitor your spam and junk email folders, as important communications regarding your application may be directed there.If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.About UsPeel Region consists of the cities of Brampton and Mississauga, and the town of Caledon. Peel Region delivers essential services to more than 1.5 million residents and approximately 175,000 businesses.We’re working to create a community that is safe, inclusive, and accessible. A place where everyone feels they belong and can access the services they need to thrive throughout each stage of life.Our workforce is 6,700 strong and s ince 1974, we’ve been delivering a wide range of resident focused services. Our services include paramedic services, health programs, long-term care and services for seniors, child care support, garbage collection and recycling, waste water and water treatment, road maintenance, financial assistance, and housing support.Recognized by Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® with the  Great Employer Award  presented by Excellence Canada, Peel Region is a place where everyone feels they belong. We strive to develop a workplace that values and respects diversity, practices inclusion, recognizes the unique contributions and abilities of all people and facilitates innovative thinking. At Peel Region, people come first. Each employee has an important role within our community and when we work together, it’s impactful. We encourage you to join us in delivering essential services and programs to our diverse community. You won't find a better opportunity than Peel Region.Additional InformationPeel Region is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.Peel Region is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.caPlease be advised, Peel Region uses email to communicate with applicants for open job competitions and does not use AI technology in any part of the recruitment process. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e., testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Park Paving Ltd. has been locally owned and operated for almost 50 years as one of the largest road construction contractors in Edmonton, and we are looking for an BASE CREW FOREMAN to work with our company's Base division for the upcoming 2024 road construction season.This is a seasonal position that offers competitive wage with benefits. This includes the use of a company truck to and from work, and for all other company business.The primary duties for this position will include, but are not limited to:Placement and construction of gravel road base structuresMeasure and order materials for daily requirementsMaintain time and material records necessary to complete daily job costingDirectly supervise, educate, and train employeesEnsure a safe work environment in compliance with all safety policies and proceduresAdhere to all company policies and provincial regulations for safe working procedures and environmentPerform daily field level hazard assessments in compliance with company policiesAbility to discuss and plan daily project procedures/goals with fellow personnel to maximize productivity and workmanshipCheck to make sure that equipment functions properlyAny labour or equipment operator tasks normally associated with road constructionRequirementsAll successful candidates must:Have an understanding of the construction industry and road construction specifications and standardsMust be able to check grade and efficientlyDisplay a professional and courteous approach with co-workers, supervisors, and the publicMust be physically fit – repetitive bending, lifting, kneeling, walking for long periods of timeBe able to work in inclement weather, heat and humidity, and exposure to dust and asphaltPunctual and able to work full time, overtime, and weekendsAbility to run grader, loader, skid-steer, and packing equipmentSuccessful candidates will also possess the interpersonal skills needed to take direction and coordinate their efforts with their crew and foremen, while maintaining a positive and respectful work environment. Successful candidates will also be able to maintain a *safety-minded* and *high accountability* work culture while working with their direct supervisors, and other employees while maintaining a positive and respectful work environment. Successful candidates must have a driving record free of major infractions, and must pass a medical/fitness exam, as conditions of employment. ***Pay Scale $37 - $44#PPLMP

Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Industry Category: Retail Art Supplies, Design Services, and Movies, Videos, and Sound
Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Our unique service offering enables us to seamlessly integrate design and technology into built concepts that enhance the way people connect and interact with their environment, creating memorable user interactions and experiences.As a team, we continuously seek new and innovative ways to grow our business. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We are incredibly proud of the team we have built and are looking for like-minded individuals to help us in our growth trajectory.Summary Of PositionEnvision is hiring an experienced Designer to join our progressive team. The primary role of the Designer is deliver outstanding retail and environmental design solutions for existing and new client business opportunities, reporting to the Account Manager for each project and in collaboration with other departments such as project management, technology and production. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and is confident expressing creative opinions and technical detailing drawings. They will also be able to articulate design rationales to clients to assist in delivering final project solutions.ROLE & RESPONSIBILITY Create compelling design solutions to serve the needs of existing clients, new business relationships and RFP submissions. Own the complete design process from ideation to implementation, working either independently or collectively with the rest of the design team Mentor junior design team in the creation of retail fixtures, environments, signage and displays. Provide clear and concise written and verbal communication to clients, suppliers and the design team – from strategy and concept presentations to team guidance and instruction. Work with Production, Technology and Engineering teams to develop concept drawings into manufacturable designs, providing technical drawings for quoting where required. Provide quality assurance on creative and physical deliverables. Perform with equal enthusiasm and creative input for both client-related and internal design tasks Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skills.Qualifications Post-Secondary Degree or College Diploma in Industrial Design, Interior Design, Architecture, or similar creative studies Interdisciplinary Studies or equivalent 7+ years’ experience as a proven hands-on design professional, preferably working on retail fixtures and environments A portfolio that demonstrates experience with various aspects of Industrial Design, Fixture Design, Environmental Design, and Retail Design work within an established design/branding firm or in-house studio (including but not limited to conceptual design, design intent drawings, engineering drawings, etc.) A portfolio that demonstrates a balanced blend of creative talent and technical understanding (create fresh, exciting concepts while having an understanding—even at a basic level—of the hardware, technologies, fabrication, and finishes required to bring those concepts into fruition) Strong conceptual thinking, including the ability to present ideas and concepts to others An understanding of, and design experience in integrating digital into fixtures and environments would be highly valued. Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

About Sweat And TonicSweat and Tonic (S&T) is Toronto's most innovative and exciting boutique fitness and wellness hub, offering the widest collection of expertly programmed Yoga, Pilates, HIIT, and Ride group fitness classes in Canada. We create a curated, immersive fitness experience for sweat enthusiasts to challenge their minds and bodies within a community that grows, succeeds, and celebrates together. With premium spa facilities, high-tech biohacking amenities, café, and bar offerings, members can recharge, recover, and reignite. Tonic House, the multi-functional lounge, workspace, and event venue, inspires collaboration and innovation. Since opening in 2019, we've innovated and expanded our state-of-the art classes across multiple channels: In-studio, Sweat in the Park, Sweat Live, Sweat on Demand, and Sweat on the Roof – a one-of-a-kind, outdoor rooftop fitness studio in the heart of downtown Toronto. Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. QualificationsDiplôme universitaire ou DEC en design d’intérieurMinimum de 2 ans d’expériencesMembre de l’APDIQMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)Maîtrise du logiciel Autodesk Revit®, suite Microsoft Office et Enscape3DConnaissances du cadre législatif et réglementaire en matière de construction (ex. : CCQ, CNBC)Formation ou accréditation LEED ou WELLÊtre méthodique et soucieux de la qualité du travailFaire preuve d’autonomie, de polyvalence et de créativitéEsprit ouvert, positif et collaboratif Informations complémentairesContribuer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et attentionnée. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Notre culture et ADN sauront vous exprimer la reconnaissance de votre travail, vos talents et vos compétencesPoste permanents : 36h présence/télétravail avec horaire flexible. Salaire concurrentiel et vacances bonifiéesProgramme de formation continue et soutien au développement de carrièreProgramme de remboursement de la cotisation professionnelleÉquipements technologiques fournisActivités sociales, sportives, de santé ou bien êtreLieu de travail ; Laval - quartier Duvernay avec stationnement, verdure et espace détente extérieure : près du Parc de la nature, d’une garderie, d’une pâtisserie et d’autres services de quartier.

Job Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The company is joined by top-tier, global venture funds and angel investors.Role:We are seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive the product strategy at Parallelz. Compliance and Security:Ensure the playable ads solution adheres to data security and privacy regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant standardsWork with the engineering team to implement robust security measures to safeguard user dataRequirementsUnderstanding within the mobile apps or mobile games ecosystems5+ years of experience in product management inside of a mobile app or platform ecosystem2+ years in leadership position as a part of, or reporting to a senior leadership positionExperience in a fast pace, early-stage startup environmentDemonstrated success in driving product strategy, roadmaps, and delivering products to marketStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-makingAbility to product plan and evaluate trade-offs in order to define priorities, communicate them upwards, and put together comprehensive product plansBonus: Understanding of ads ecosystemBonus: Software development background or experience leading an engineering teamsBonus: Resides in the Toronto regionBenefitsThis is a full-time remote position. We offer a competitive salary, benefits, and an Employee Stock Option Plan.

Established in 1989, Terlin has become a leader and innovator in full-service construction for retail, commercial, and institutional clients. Distinguished by their end-to-end approach and unparalleled reputation for quality and reliability, Terlin’s state-of- the-art facility houses their custom Millwork shop which provides an exclusive focus on the specialized needs of their clients. ensure projects stay within budgetary constraints.· Identification of risk and associated mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions and cost overruns.· Reviewing project documents (drawings, specifications, RFI’s, etc.) and evaluating the completeness for the respective phase of design and/or construction.· Implementing and enforcing quality control processes to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and client expectations.· Evaluating requested changes and managing the change process.· Project reporting and updating relevant stakeholders / team members on project progress.· Prioritizing and enforcing safety protocols to protect the well-being of all personnel on constructions sites.· Identifying business opportunities with current and prospective customers and by researching the industry and market trends.· Procuring and executing a portfolio of projects ranging from multiple small projects to major site improvements.· Collaborating with the Finance department as it relates to budgets, expenses, and profits as well as detecting cost-related issues.· Coaching and supporting project team members with assigned tasks.The successful candidate is a self-starter who possesses excellent communication skills, is extremely organized, detail-oriented, has a positive attitude and a vast knowledge of construction and trades.Qualifications· Minimum fifteen (15) years of construction industry project management involving retail and ICI works.· Base building construction experience.· Strong business acumen as it relates to full project management including conceptual / detailed estimating, scheduling, cost controls, reporting, and demonstrated ability to manage budgets and schedules within project expectations.· Ability to recognize issues as challenges and the capacity to work well under pressure.· Professional and diplomatic.· Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills are critical for managing and leading diverse cross-functional teams.· Ability and willingness to travel periodically.· Knowledge of Canadian Building Code.· Excellent time management and computer skills.· Ability to motivate, think outside the box when needed, and willingness to adapt to new concepts.· A valid Secret security clearance (or ability to successfully obtain same) is a requirement of the position.· Bilingual (English and French) would be considered an asset.· Proficiency in construction software (Procore) and scheduling tools (MS Project) would be considered a significant asset.· PMP Designation would be an asset.· A valid driver’s license is required.What Terlin Has to OfferTerlin offers employees the opportunity to work on innovative projects alongside dynamic, dedicated, and talented teams who possess a strong drive for success.Their comprehensive benefits package is designed to meet the demands of each individual’s life at work as well as at home. The benefit programs are also complemented with RRSP matching and profit sharing.Terlin is an equal-opportunity employer and values diversity and inclusiveness in their company.Do you have the drive, the experience, and the commitment to excellence to be part of the Terlin Team?If you think you have what it takes and would like to join an organization that offers proven corporate leadership, opportunities for career advancement, great team spirit, and a collaborative environment, then let Terlin provide you with an excellent place to work, grow, and excel!To learn more about Terlin Construction Ltd., visit their website at www.terlin.ca.We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those qualified will be contacted for an interview.

Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Location: 7120 Hurontario St., MississaugaHours of Work: 35 hours per weekWho we are: Peel Housing Corporation provides safe, well maintained living environments for tenants in Peel Living and Region of Peel owned properties including: 71 residential properties, two transitional housing residences and three emergency shelters. These services contribute to a positive experience for residents and enhance neighbourhoods where the buildings are located.In this role you will be responsible for supporting execution of projects for common area and in-suite renovation and other state of good repair related Capital Works within the Peel Living portfolio. As a member of the Peel Housing Corporation (O/A Peel Living) Infrastructure and Planning Services team. As the Specialist, you will provide technical expertise/guidance and oversee work including supporting the Project Manager in execution of projects, design development, specification and standards development, contract administration and construction inspection.What You Will Do In This RoleTechnical, Design and Specification preparation and Construction Inspection: Develops design concepts and associated presentation materials based on research & resolution of technical/ design issues.  Develops construction documents for projects of varying scope with minimal supervision.  Modifies and update designs based on review comments from senior staff.  Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work.  Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules.  Preparation of contract documents / scoping and integration with Engineering drawings as necessary.  Supports execution of technical design assignments in a timely manner.  Supports Senior staff with effective analysis of applicable building codes, by-laws and other regulations and technical documents / reports to which a project may be subject.  Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. What The Role Requires Post-secondary diploma/degree/certificate in an architectural or design program or a combination of education and experience may be considered  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the fields of Interior Design, Architecture, or construction and working with various building trades, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.  Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Our unique service offering enables us to seamlessly integrate design and technology into built concepts that enhance the way people connect and interact with their environment, creating memorable user interactions and experiences.As a team, we continuously seek new and innovative ways to grow our business. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We are incredibly proud of the team we have built and are looking for like-minded individuals to help us in our growth trajectory.Summary Of PositionEnvision is hiring an experienced Designer to join our progressive team. The primary role of the Designer is deliver outstanding retail and environmental design solutions for existing and new client business opportunities, reporting to the Account Manager for each project and in collaboration with other departments such as project management, technology and production. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and is confident expressing creative opinions and technical detailing drawings.
