Job Description: Valard Construction LP is Canada's premier powerline contractor, serving clients in both public & private sectors. We offer construction services in overhead and underground transmission and distribution systems, substations, fibre optics, as well as substation and transmission foundations.Valard Construction LP is looking to hire a Transmission & Distribution Estimator who will be responsible for compiling cost estimates to a client or potential client with products or services primarily for overhead distribution and transmission lines. He or she will do this by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. The best price isn't always the lowest one, and clients now award contracts based on quality of the service offered, as well as cost.RequirementsDuties and ResponsibilitiesAssemble estimates from various sources into a complete and final estimate for the company with Engineering support as requiredDevelop an understanding of indirect and conceptual estimating techniques and theoriesReview and validate outsourced estimates with support from engineerReview and incorporate historical data from estimates received, contracts awarded by the EPC Contractor and final actual project costs into Valard's cost modelFormat estimates in Owners Reporting formatReviewing and understanding of the Design Basis, Engineering Design Documents, and Basis of EstimateDevelops complete estimates on selected projects consisting of project site visit, quantity take-off, pricing, and presentation of the estimate for cost engineering and management reviewProvide estimating input on complex "conceptual" transmission projectsProvide guidance for non-estimating personnel on their estimating related requirementsAttend and assist in project planning sessions and team meetings to provide estimating inputInterface and communicate effectively (written and oral) with the estimating team, with all levels of management, clients and industry contacts; contacts and develops business relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimatesDevelop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics; including, when required, construction and work procedures for specific activities related to a bidDevelop or assist in the development of preliminary project schedulesPerform additional assignments per supervisor's directionKnowledge/ Skills:Experience in estimating, cost control, construction management and/or engineering with estimating experience in projects ranging from $0.5M to $25MUnderstanding of construction documents and the ability to assess the level of completenessHas developed technical knowledge of estimating practices, techniques and equipmentAccurate data input and calculating skillsKnowledge of construction costs and budgets, ability to develop a project scheduleSolid computer skills; Proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Project and ExcelAble to read drawings and specificationsThe ability to work in a team environmentAbility to validate proposals, manage multiple priorities and work under pressure with minimal supervisionAbility to identify problems/issues, looks beyond the immediate problem to the wider implications and generates possible solutionsVerifiable work references demonstrating exceptional skills and achievements including:A high level of professionalism; Dependable, results-focused and ethicalStrong organizational, multi-tasking and planning skillsStrong customer serviceStrong verbal and written communication skillsCapable of adapting information/style to the audience, explains difficult information clearly and influences and persuades others towards consensus agreement in straightforward situationsEDUCATION B.Sc. degree in Engineering, Bachelor of Commerce Degree (BCom), Construction Management Certificate, or equivalent combination of relevant experience and educationBenefitsValard Construction LP is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and a complete range of employee benefits.We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' education and experience best meets the needs of the position. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

Position OverviewConstruction Ontario trains with the future in mind. We deliver supportive and innovative recruitment solutions for small, medium, and large construction employers. Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. QualificationsDiplôme universitaire ou DEC en design d’intérieurMinimum de 2 ans d’expériencesMembre de l’APDIQMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)Maîtrise du logiciel Autodesk Revit®, suite Microsoft Office et Enscape3DConnaissances du cadre législatif et réglementaire en matière de construction (ex. : CCQ, CNBC)Formation ou accréditation LEED ou WELLÊtre méthodique et soucieux de la qualité du travailFaire preuve d’autonomie, de polyvalence et de créativitéEsprit ouvert, positif et collaboratif Informations complémentairesContribuer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et attentionnée. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The company is joined by top-tier, global venture funds and angel investors.Role:We are seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive the product strategy at Parallelz. You will report directly to the CEO and be responsible for driving product management for a highly technical and disruptive technology platform. Your responsibilities will include customer development, requirements synthesis, and product strategy.Key Responsibilities:Product Strategy and Vision:Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and stay ahead of industry trendsCollaborate with stakeholders to develop a product roadmap that addresses customer needs and business objectivesTechnical Expertise:Possess an understanding of the mobile app ecosystems, mobile ad tech, and mobile data science and analytics to effectively communicate and guide engineering teamsTranslate high-level technical requirements into actionable tasks for the engineering team, ensuring successful implementation of the playable ads solutionStay updated with the latest advancements in mobile technology, emerging platforms, and machine learning to ensure the product stays competitive and cutting-edgeProduct Development:Lead the end-to-end product development process, from ideation to launch, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of features and enhancementsWork closely with senior leadership and other functions to bring the product to market successfullyDefine key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics, continually monitor the product's performance, and drive continuous improvementsCollaboration and Communication:Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders and effectively communicate the product strategy, progress, and outcomesConduct regular product updates and presentations to internal teams and external partnersBonus - Compliance and Security:Ensure the playable ads solution adheres to data security and privacy regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant standardsWork with the engineering team to implement robust security measures to safeguard user dataRequirementsUnderstanding within the mobile apps or mobile games ecosystems5+ years of experience in product management inside of a mobile app or platform ecosystem2+ years in leadership position as a part of, or reporting to a senior leadership positionExperience in a fast pace, early-stage startup environmentDemonstrated success in driving product strategy, roadmaps, and delivering products to marketStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-makingAbility to product plan and evaluate trade-offs in order to define priorities, communicate them upwards, and put together comprehensive product plansBonus: Understanding of ads ecosystemBonus: Software development background or experience leading an engineering teamsBonus: Resides in the Toronto regionBenefitsThis is a full-time remote position. We offer construction services in overhead and underground transmission and distribution systems, substations, fibre optics, as well as substation and transmission foundations.Valard Construction LP is looking to hire a Transmission & Distribution Estimator who will be responsible for compiling cost estimates to a client or potential client with products or services primarily for overhead distribution and transmission lines. He or she will do this by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. The best price isn't always the lowest one, and clients now award contracts based on quality of the service offered, as well as cost.RequirementsDuties and ResponsibilitiesAssemble estimates from various sources into a complete and final estimate for the company with Engineering support as requiredDevelop an understanding of indirect and conceptual estimating techniques and theoriesReview and validate outsourced estimates with support from engineerReview and incorporate historical data from estimates received, contracts awarded by the EPC Contractor and final actual project costs into Valard's cost modelFormat estimates in Owners Reporting formatReviewing and understanding of the Design Basis, Engineering Design Documents, and Basis of EstimateDevelops complete estimates on selected projects consisting of project site visit, quantity take-off, pricing, and presentation of the estimate for cost engineering and management reviewProvide estimating input on complex "conceptual" transmission projectsProvide guidance for non-estimating personnel on their estimating related requirementsAttend and assist in project planning sessions and team meetings to provide estimating inputInterface and communicate effectively (written and oral) with the estimating team, with all levels of management, clients and industry contacts; contacts and develops business relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimatesDevelop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics; including, when required, construction and work procedures for specific activities related to a bidDevelop or assist in the development of preliminary project schedulesPerform additional assignments per supervisor's directionKnowledge/ Skills:Experience in estimating, cost control, construction management and/or engineering with estimating experience in projects ranging from $0.5M to $25MUnderstanding of construction documents and the ability to assess the level of completenessHas developed technical knowledge of estimating practices, techniques and equipmentAccurate data input and calculating skillsKnowledge of construction costs and budgets, ability to develop a project scheduleSolid computer skills; Dependable, results-focused and ethicalStrong organizational, multi-tasking and planning skillsStrong customer serviceStrong verbal and written communication skillsCapable of adapting information/style to the audience, explains difficult information clearly and influences and persuades others towards consensus agreement in straightforward situationsEDUCATION B.Sc. degree in Engineering, Bachelor of Commerce Degree (BCom), Construction Management Certificate, or equivalent combination of relevant experience and educationBenefitsValard Construction LP is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse workforce. Company:    Southbridge Health Care LPLocation:     Ontario Region (Head Office - Cambridge)Position:      Project Manager – Permanent Full-timePosition DescriptionSouthbridge is looking for an experienced Project Manager for long-term care redevelopment and Capex projects. The successful candidate will oversee the planning, implementation and tracking of long-term care redevelopment and Capex projects. The successful candidate must possess the knowledge, experience, and confidence to engage and professionally interact with design professionals and consultants, while successfully directing construction related personnel in planning, coordinating and safely executing work in accordance with contract documents, schedule and budget. The successful candidate must be professional and a personable leader, dedicated to bringing in projects on time and on budget.As Project Manager, you’ll work as team member, managing multiple projects at various stages of development. Opportunities will include managing all aspects of Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care, municipal and code approvals. You will also manage schedules, budgets, design, drawings and specifications for each project.ResponsibilitiesThe Project Manager performs a wide range of duties including but not limited to all the following:Define the scope of the project in collaboration with the Vice President of Development Create a detailed work plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project Determine resources required to complete the project Develop a schedule for project completion that effectively allocates resources to activities Review project schedule with senior management and all other staff that will be affected by the project activities; revise the schedule as required Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion Work with internal team and hired designers/consultants to establish initial design, specification accuracy, drawing and tender accuracy Assess and contract qualified consultants and engineers to work on the project as appropriate Execute the project according to the project plan Document project activities Monitor the progress of the project and adjust as necessary to ensure successful completion on time and on budget Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets Southbridge standards Write reports on the project for management Monitor and approve all budgeted project expenditures Manage all project funds according to established accounting policies and procedures Ensure that all financial records for the project are up to date Ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase QualificationsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesKnowledge of project management methodology and tools Proficiency in the use of software for scheduling, budgeting, MS Office Personal characteristicsThe successful candidate should be able to demonstrate competence in all of the following:Behave Ethically: Understand ethical behavior and business practices, and ensure that own behavior and the behavior of others is consistent with these standards and aligns with the values of Southbridge. Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques. Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the project and to create new opportunities. Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness. Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of Southbridge. Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of Southbridge. Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals and track details/data/information/activities. Plan: Determine strategies to move the project forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans and evaluate the process and results. Solve Problems: Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem. Experience5 to 10 years in project management construction, planning and management experience Working ConditionsProject Managers usually work in an office environment, but the purpose of the project may sometimes take them to non-standard workplaces including travel for regularly scheduled site meetings. Project Managers work a standard work week but may be required to work some evenings and weekends to meet project milestones. a valid Ontario Driver’s License and have access to own transportationEquity, Diversity and Inclusion StatementThe York Region District School Board (YRDSB) believes in giving each and every applicant We value and respect the contributions that each person brings to enriching the Board and are committed to ensuring full and equal participation for all in the communities that we serve.Accessibility and Accommodation StatementWe also recognize the duty to accommodate and foster a culture of inclusion. All information received relating to a candidate’s required accommodation will be addressed confidentially by the Recruitment and Retention Team. Please make this request to careers@yrdsb.ca or a member of the Recruitment Team. If this position is a school based LTO/Contract Teaching position, please email the Principal directly to request the accommodation to be made at the school in collaboration with Human Resource Services, Disability Management Team.Important Note for YRDSB Employees: If you have a current accommodation in place through Disability Management, please inform your Disability Management Case Manager to ensure that your accommodation needs can be met in the new role that you are pursuing. If invited to participate in the hiring process, and you are unable to perform the essential/bona fide requirements (e.g. physical, cognitive requirements), please notify the Recruitment Team by emailing careers@yrdsb.ca to review next steps (in the email please reference the job title you are applying to).Important Information For CUPE 1734 MembersLA.11.7 Those twelve (12) month employees filling vacancies as a result of their applying to a job posting are to remain twelve (12) months at their position. Ten (10) month employees are to remain in their position until the end of the school year. Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Location: 7120 Hurontario St., MississaugaHours of Work: 35 hours per weekWho we are: Peel Housing Corporation provides safe, well maintained living environments for tenants in Peel Living and Region of Peel owned properties including: 71 residential properties, two transitional housing residences and three emergency shelters. These services contribute to a positive experience for residents and enhance neighbourhoods where the buildings are located.In this role you will be responsible for supporting execution of projects for common area and in-suite renovation and other state of good repair related Capital Works within the Peel Living portfolio. As a member of the Peel Housing Corporation (O/A Peel Living) Infrastructure and Planning Services team. As the Specialist, you will provide technical expertise/guidance and oversee work including supporting the Project Manager in execution of projects, design development, specification and standards development, contract administration and construction inspection.What You Will Do In This RoleTechnical, Design and Specification preparation and Construction Inspection: Develops design concepts and associated presentation materials based on research & resolution of technical/ design issues.  Develops construction documents for projects of varying scope with minimal supervision.  Modifies and update designs based on review comments from senior staff.  Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work.  Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules.  Preparation of contract documents / scoping and integration with Engineering drawings as necessary.  Supports execution of technical design assignments in a timely manner.  Supports Senior staff with effective analysis of applicable building codes, by-laws and other regulations and technical documents / reports to which a project may be subject.  Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. What The Role Requires Post-secondary diploma/degree/certificate in an architectural or design program or a combination of education and experience may be considered  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the fields of Interior Design, Architecture, or construction and working with various building trades, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.  Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. Nice To Have Ability to become OAA member/licensed Architect or Technologist or a Registered Interior designer with ARIDO would be considered an asset.  National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. Perks @ Peel and why you will love working for us: Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision benefit plan including psychological health (effective start date)  Automatic enrolment into OMERS pension plan (where applicable)  Accrue Vacation on a monthly basis (where applicable) up to 3 weeks per annum  3 Paid personal days and floating holidays  Flexible hours supporting your wellness and wellbeing  Annual performance review and merit increases based on performance (where applicable)  Supportive leadership and a culture of respect and inclusion  Access to tuition reimbursement (where applicable) and learning and development resources Work Mode & Job Location:  In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario St., Mississaugaworksite. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario. The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.  Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.Kindly ensure to regularly monitor your spam and junk email folders, as important communications regarding your application may be directed there.If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.About UsPeel Region consists of the cities of Brampton and Mississauga, and the town of Caledon. Peel Region delivers essential services to more than 1.5 million residents and approximately 175,000 businesses.We’re working to create a community that is safe, inclusive, and accessible. A place where everyone feels they belong and can access the services they need to thrive throughout each stage of life.Our workforce is 6,700 strong and s ince 1974, we’ve been delivering a wide range of resident focused services. Our services include paramedic services, health programs, long-term care and services for seniors, child care support, garbage collection and recycling, waste water and water treatment, road maintenance, financial assistance, and housing support.Recognized by Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® with the  Great Employer Award  presented by Excellence Canada, Peel Region is a place where everyone feels they belong. We strive to develop a workplace that values and respects diversity, practices inclusion, recognizes the unique contributions and abilities of all people and facilitates innovative thinking. At Peel Region, people come first. Each employee has an important role within our community and when we work together, it’s impactful. We encourage you to join us in delivering essential services and programs to our diverse community. You won't find a better opportunity than Peel Region.Additional InformationPeel Region is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.Peel Region is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e., testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Industry Category: Retail Art Supplies, Design Services, and Movies, Videos, and Sound
Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Our unique service offering enables us to seamlessly integrate design and technology into built concepts that enhance the way people connect and interact with their environment, creating memorable user interactions and experiences.As a team, we continuously seek new and innovative ways to grow our business. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We are incredibly proud of the team we have built and are looking for like-minded individuals to help us in our growth trajectory.Summary Of PositionEnvision is hiring an experienced Designer to join our progressive team. The primary role of the Designer is deliver outstanding retail and environmental design solutions for existing and new client business opportunities, reporting to the Account Manager for each project and in collaboration with other departments such as project management, technology and production. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and is confident expressing creative opinions and technical detailing drawings. They will also be able to articulate design rationales to clients to assist in delivering final project solutions.ROLE & RESPONSIBILITY Create compelling design solutions to serve the needs of existing clients, new business relationships and RFP submissions. Own the complete design process from ideation to implementation, working either independently or collectively with the rest of the design team Mentor junior design team in the creation of retail fixtures, environments, signage and displays. Provide clear and concise written and verbal communication to clients, suppliers and the design team – from strategy and concept presentations to team guidance and instruction. Work with Production, Technology and Engineering teams to develop concept drawings into manufacturable designs, providing technical drawings for quoting where required. Provide quality assurance on creative and physical deliverables. Perform with equal enthusiasm and creative input for both client-related and internal design tasks Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skills.Qualifications Post-Secondary Degree or College Diploma in Industrial Design, Interior Design, Architecture, or similar creative studies Interdisciplinary Studies or equivalent 7+ years’ experience as a proven hands-on design professional, preferably working on retail fixtures and environments A portfolio that demonstrates experience with various aspects of Industrial Design, Fixture Design, Environmental Design, and Retail Design work within an established design/branding firm or in-house studio (including but not limited to conceptual design, design intent drawings, engineering drawings, etc.) A portfolio that demonstrates a balanced blend of creative talent and technical understanding (create fresh, exciting concepts while having an understanding—even at a basic level—of the hardware, technologies, fabrication, and finishes required to bring those concepts into fruition) Strong conceptual thinking, including the ability to present ideas and concepts to others An understanding of, and design experience in integrating digital into fixtures and environments would be highly valued. Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

We are looking for our next, great Assistant Superintendent for our single family, housebuilding operation in Edmonton You are a builder. You like to get your hands dirty, direct the action, be the hub of communication and be able to stand back and feel proud of what you are building. You want to work with construction professionals who build quality single family homes, safely, with both the community and the homeowners’ best interests in mind.You willDeliver on company values such as Teamwork, Results and PassionEnsure momentum on the project is created and sustainedKnow how to drive results even when the chips are downCommunicate priorities with conviction and candorEmbrace the Anthem WayWhat you'll doAssume overall responsibility for all on-site construction activities for the homes under your supervisionMaintain constant communications with senior management, inspectors and all applicable officials related to the ongoing construction of the projectEnsure all work is performed by contractors and suppliers to contract documents (including drawings, specifications and contract scopes of work)Review all project plans, specifications, applicable documentation and report any omissions or discrepancies directly to the Construction ManagerReview and maintain the construction schedule and ensure that all contractors and suppliers comply with the critical dates they are required to meetTake full responsibility to ensure that all Municipal inspections, professional inspections, occupancy permits, and possession dates have been achieved to the satisfaction of the construction managerAssume direct responsibility to ensure the quality of construction, products and finishing are meet or exceed Anthem standardsMonitor and enforce all Anthem Safety rules and regulations as they relate to AB OH&S Legislation to ensure a safe jobsiteYou haveProven experience leading and directing all field personnelA thorough understanding of the entire construction process - preferably with exposure to wood frame construction and single family homesExcellent verbal and written communication skillsThe ability to get things doneWe haveGreat, diverse, authentic people!Unlimited career growth opportunitiesMentorship from the ‘best in the biz’Corporate Giving Strategy supporting community developmentAnnual salary reviews and performance bonuses100% employer paid Benefit Plan with Healthcare Spending Account and Employee Assistance ProgramEducational Assistance Program‘Dress for your day’ policy… and more!Safety First. Always. We’re proud our in-house Construction team is COR Certified. Our talented 100+ team members will forever shape neighbourhoods and cities across Alberta, B.C. and Sacramento. Safely.Anthem is a real estate development, investment and management company that strives, solves and evolves to create better spaces and stronger communities. We are Growing Places.We work hard. We work smart. We work in teams. We challenge the status quo and have fun doing it. We believe in developing our people to maximize their potential. Conversations are candid, conflict is swiftly resolved, and coaching is continuous.Founded in 1991, Anthem is a team of 450 people driven by creativity, passion and direct communication. Anthem has invested in, developed or managed – alone or in partnership – more than 310 residential, commercial and retail projects across western North America. Our growing residential portfolio includes 17,500 homes that are complete, in design or under construction, from master planned mixed use residential and multifamily, to townhome and single family communities. We own, co-own, manage or have previously owned over 8.5 million square feet of retail, industrial, residential rental and office space. We have developed more than 60 communities across 7,400 acres of land in Alberta, British Columbia and California.Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies. View our Policy on Unsolicited Resumes on our website.

Company DescriptionArcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.Job DescriptionAt Arcadis, our Transit Facilities Design professionals thrive on solving problems by putting their logic and creativity together. They are able to invent, explore, and question to enhance the areas around us. As a member of our Team, you will have the opportunity to work on unique and leading-edge projects with a local and international focus.You’ll have the opportunity to work with a fast-paced, driven team with a proven success record in both design and technical excellence!We are looking for a Project Coordinator with previous experience working as a project coordinator or junior project manager on transit projects or projects with large, multidisciplinary teams. The successful candidate will hold a degree in Architecture or Engineering and have a minimum of 5 years of experience, will have strong written and verbal communication and organizational skills, with an ability to think quickly to resolve problems in real time, and will also have a holistic understanding of the project delivery process.Role Responsibilities:As a Project Coordinator in the transit studio, your role accountabilities will include: Assist with the coordination, management, monitor and reporting of project milestones.Integrate and coordinate with all disciplines as required to complete project tasks.Liaise with extensive teams of consultants and contractors.Develop and maintain logs, registers and other tables for tracking purposes.Liaise with document control and assist disciplines with document submissions including quality checks process.Coordinate meetings, agendas and minutes.Requirement to work from a project office (currently in downtown Toronto).QualificationsQualifications and Experience:Minimum University Bachelor’s Degree; in Architecture or Engineering.Must have at least 5 years of proven work experience as a Project Coordinator in the Architecture or Engineering industry.Previous experience working on large and complex engineering or architecture projects from concept to delivery – P3 experience is an asset.Previous experience with interpreting and developing project scheduling, plans, managing budget and risks including document and quality control.Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple deadlines and work under pressure is expected.Previous experience with Primavera or similar project scheduling software is an asset.Proficiency MS Excel and other Microsoft applications such as Word, Powerpoint, Outlook.Proficiency Acrobat or Bluebeam for document mark-ups and comments.Proficiency with FTP, Project Wise, SharePoint, ISO, MS Office. PM+ experience is an assetModerate experience in Revit, Microstation and AutoCAD in order to navigate and identify file content is an asset.Strong communication and presentation skills – both written and verbal.Additional InformationWe can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life, and the world around you.Together, we can create a lasting legacy.Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging:As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex, and sexual orientation.We request applicants submit a RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. For design related roles, we also require a portfolio to review.We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.As part of Arcadis selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence, drug testing and driver’s license record.Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

Architectural Sales Representative - Aluminum Building Materials (Cladding).Job Title: Architectural Sales Representative - Aluminum Building Materials (Cladding).Location: Aurora, Ontario.Company Overview: Alumax Panel, a leading Canadian entity in the domain of Aluminum Architectural Cladding Solutions, is seeking a dynamic Architectural Sales Representative to join our team. You will be the driving force behind introducing our groundbreaking product, Altalyte, and other aluminum decorative materials to these key sectors.Key ResponsibilitiesGenerate new leads and manage existing accounts to grow Alumax Panel’s market share.Provide technical presentations and product demonstrations to architects and developers.Organize and conduct 'Lunch and Learn' sessions to educate clients about our products.Attend industry events, fostering relationships and enhancing brand visibility.Deliver insights and strategies for presenting our materials effectively in the market.Collaborate with internal teams to align sales strategies with company goals.Contribute to continuous improvement by providing feedback from field experiences.QualificationsProven sales experience in the building materials industry.Strong technical knowledge of cladding materials.Established relationships with architects, builders, and related industry professionals.Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Willingness to travel as required.Performance MetricsSuccess in this role will be measured through a variety of metrics including client meetings scheduled, new prospect development, and contribution to quarterly sales targets.Our expectation is a proactive approach to market engagement and a consistent drive for business development.What We OfferA competitive salary with performance-based incentives.Opportunities for professional growth and development within a dynamic and innovative company.A collaborative and supportive work environment.Application Process: Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter detailing their experience and suitability for the role.About Alumax Panel Inc.Alumax Panel has a rich history of experience in the construction industry and has been involved in the development of many commercial properties, both interior and exterior -. About Sweat And TonicSweat and Tonic (S&T) is Toronto's most innovative and exciting boutique fitness and wellness hub, offering the widest collection of expertly programmed Yoga, Pilates, HIIT, and Ride group fitness classes in Canada. We create a curated, immersive fitness experience for sweat enthusiasts to challenge their minds and bodies within a community that grows, succeeds, and celebrates together. With premium spa facilities, high-tech biohacking amenities, café, and bar offerings, members can recharge, recover, and reignite. Tonic House, the multi-functional lounge, workspace, and event venue, inspires collaboration and innovation. Since opening in 2019, we've innovated and expanded our state-of-the art classes across multiple channels: In-studio, Sweat in the Park, Sweat Live, Sweat on Demand, and Sweat on the Roof – a one-of-a-kind, outdoor rooftop fitness studio in the heart of downtown Toronto. In 2023, we opened our first international sister location, Silver Springs, a boutique yoga and Pilates oasis in the heart of Los Angeles, and a new 25,000 sq.ft. immersive fitness & wellness hub in Toronto at The Well. This is a unique, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to become a part of a passionate, dynamic team that is here to disrupt the fitness industry.About The RoleWe are seeking a full-time Project Manager to support the expansion of the S&T brand to future locations in Toronto and beyond, and management of annual business initiatives within the organization. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Job Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life. The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work. Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. About Sweat And TonicSweat and Tonic (S&T) is Toronto's most innovative and exciting boutique fitness and wellness hub, offering the widest collection of expertly programmed Yoga, Pilates, HIIT, and Ride group fitness classes in Canada. We create a curated, immersive fitness experience for sweat enthusiasts to challenge their minds and bodies within a community that grows, succeeds, and celebrates together. With premium spa facilities, high-tech biohacking amenities, café, and bar offerings, members can recharge, recover, and reignite. Tonic House, the multi-functional lounge, workspace, and event venue, inspires collaboration and innovation. Since opening in 2019, we've innovated and expanded our state-of-the art classes across multiple channels: In-studio, Sweat in the Park, Sweat Live, Sweat on Demand, and Sweat on the Roof – a one-of-a-kind, outdoor rooftop fitness studio in the heart of downtown Toronto. In 2023, we opened our first international sister location, Silver Springs, a boutique yoga and Pilates oasis in the heart of Los Angeles, and a new 25,000 sq.ft. immersive fitness & wellness hub in Toronto at The Well. Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups.
