Successful candidates must have a driving record free of major infractions, and must pass a medical/fitness exam, as conditions of employment. ***Pay Scale $37 - $44#PPLMP

Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Location: 7120 Hurontario St., MississaugaHours of Work: 35 hours per weekWho we are: Peel Housing Corporation provides safe, well maintained living environments for tenants in Peel Living and Region of Peel owned properties including: 71 residential properties, two transitional housing residences and three emergency shelters. These services contribute to a positive experience for residents and enhance neighbourhoods where the buildings are located.In this role you will be responsible for supporting execution of projects for common area and in-suite renovation and other state of good repair related Capital Works within the Peel Living portfolio. As a member of the Peel Housing Corporation (O/A Peel Living) Infrastructure and Planning Services team. As the Specialist, you will provide technical expertise/guidance and oversee work including supporting the Project Manager in execution of projects, design development, specification and standards development, contract administration and construction inspection.What You Will Do In This RoleTechnical, Design and Specification preparation and Construction Inspection: Develops design concepts and associated presentation materials based on research & resolution of technical/ design issues.  Develops construction documents for projects of varying scope with minimal supervision.  Modifies and update designs based on review comments from senior staff.  Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work.  Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules.  Preparation of contract documents / scoping and integration with Engineering drawings as necessary.  Supports execution of technical design assignments in a timely manner.  Supports Senior staff with effective analysis of applicable building codes, by-laws and other regulations and technical documents / reports to which a project may be subject.  Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. What The Role Requires Post-secondary diploma/degree/certificate in an architectural or design program or a combination of education and experience may be considered  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the fields of Interior Design, Architecture, or construction and working with various building trades, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.  Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. Nice To Have Ability to become OAA member/licensed Architect or Technologist or a Registered Interior designer with ARIDO would be considered an asset.  National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. Perks @ Peel and why you will love working for us: Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision benefit plan including psychological health (effective start date)  Automatic enrolment into OMERS pension plan (where applicable)  Accrue Vacation on a monthly basis (where applicable) up to 3 weeks per annum  3 Paid personal days and floating holidays  Flexible hours supporting your wellness and wellbeing  Annual performance review and merit increases based on performance (where applicable)  Supportive leadership and a culture of respect and inclusion  Access to tuition reimbursement (where applicable) and learning and development resources Work Mode & Job Location:  In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario St., Mississaugaworksite. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario. The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.  Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.Kindly ensure to regularly monitor your spam and junk email folders, as important communications regarding your application may be directed there.If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.About UsPeel Region consists of the cities of Brampton and Mississauga, and the town of Caledon. Peel Region delivers essential services to more than 1.5 million residents and approximately 175,000 businesses.We’re working to create a community that is safe, inclusive, and accessible. A place where everyone feels they belong and can access the services they need to thrive throughout each stage of life.Our workforce is 6,700 strong and s ince 1974, we’ve been delivering a wide range of resident focused services. Our services include paramedic services, health programs, long-term care and services for seniors, child care support, garbage collection and recycling, waste water and water treatment, road maintenance, financial assistance, and housing support.Recognized by Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® with the  Great Employer Award  presented by Excellence Canada, Peel Region is a place where everyone feels they belong. We strive to develop a workplace that values and respects diversity, practices inclusion, recognizes the unique contributions and abilities of all people and facilitates innovative thinking. At Peel Region, people come first. Each employee has an important role within our community and when we work together, it’s impactful. We encourage you to join us in delivering essential services and programs to our diverse community. You won't find a better opportunity than Peel Region.Additional InformationPeel Region is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.Peel Region is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.caPlease be advised, Peel Region uses email to communicate with applicants for open job competitions and does not use AI technology in any part of the recruitment process. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e., testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Industry Category: Retail Art Supplies, Design Services, and Movies, Videos, and Sound
Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Our unique service offering enables us to seamlessly integrate design and technology into built concepts that enhance the way people connect and interact with their environment, creating memorable user interactions and experiences.As a team, we continuously seek new and innovative ways to grow our business. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We are incredibly proud of the team we have built and are looking for like-minded individuals to help us in our growth trajectory.Summary Of PositionEnvision is hiring an experienced Designer to join our progressive team. The primary role of the Designer is deliver outstanding retail and environmental design solutions for existing and new client business opportunities, reporting to the Account Manager for each project and in collaboration with other departments such as project management, technology and production. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and is confident expressing creative opinions and technical detailing drawings. They will also be able to articulate design rationales to clients to assist in delivering final project solutions.ROLE & RESPONSIBILITY Create compelling design solutions to serve the needs of existing clients, new business relationships and RFP submissions. Own the complete design process from ideation to implementation, working either independently or collectively with the rest of the design team Mentor junior design team in the creation of retail fixtures, environments, signage and displays. Provide clear and concise written and verbal communication to clients, suppliers and the design team – from strategy and concept presentations to team guidance and instruction. Work with Production, Technology and Engineering teams to develop concept drawings into manufacturable designs, providing technical drawings for quoting where required. Provide quality assurance on creative and physical deliverables. Perform with equal enthusiasm and creative input for both client-related and internal design tasks Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skills.Qualifications Post-Secondary Degree or College Diploma in Industrial Design, Interior Design, Architecture, or similar creative studies Interdisciplinary Studies or equivalent 7+ years’ experience as a proven hands-on design professional, preferably working on retail fixtures and environments A portfolio that demonstrates experience with various aspects of Industrial Design, Fixture Design, Environmental Design, and Retail Design work within an established design/branding firm or in-house studio (including but not limited to conceptual design, design intent drawings, engineering drawings, etc.) A portfolio that demonstrates a balanced blend of creative talent and technical understanding (create fresh, exciting concepts while having an understanding—even at a basic level—of the hardware, technologies, fabrication, and finishes required to bring those concepts into fruition) Strong conceptual thinking, including the ability to present ideas and concepts to others An understanding of, and design experience in integrating digital into fixtures and environments would be highly valued. Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We offer construction services in overhead and underground transmission and distribution systems, substations, fibre optics, as well as substation and transmission foundations.Valard Construction LP is looking to hire a Transmission & Distribution Estimator who will be responsible for compiling cost estimates to a client or potential client with products or services primarily for overhead distribution and transmission lines. He or she will do this by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. contacts and develops business relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimatesDevelop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics; Join one of BC’s Top Employers!  Be part of an exceptional company culture with great employee benefits and a healthy work/life balance! BC Housing thanks all applicants for their interest; only those selected for an interview will be contacted. This position is only open to those legally entitled to work in Canada.THE ORGANIZATIONBC Housing is a provincial Crown Corporation that develops, manages and administers a wide range of subsidized housing options for those most in need across the province to address critical gaps across the housing continuum ranging from emergency shelter through to rent assistance in the private market and affordable home ownership.  Share in the rewards of working with an organization that offers challenging work and competitive compensation and supports the growth and development of its people.  Our mission is to provide access to safe, quality, accessible, and affordable housing options. We do this to promote strong, inclusive communities where people can thrive.BC Housing offers competitive salaries and an excellent benefits package. But a job is more than a pay cheque. We also offer our staff the opportunity to work together to make a difference. When employees go home at the end of the day, they experience the satisfaction of knowing they’ve helped provide safe, affordable housing for British Columbians. And while they’re here, employees can take advantage of many opportunities: In-house training, and training at other institutions, for courses related to employees’ current positions or to prepare them for advancement within BC Housing.  Wellness programs including physical fitness, programs to help employees quit smoking, free flu shots, mental health resources, and lunch-and-learn lectures and seminars.  Recognition programs including long-term service awards, idea recognition and outstanding performance awards.  Livegreen incentives include an employee transit pass program, and other initiatives that encourage alternative, sustainable transportation (even a bike purchase program!).  An active Social Club that organizes special events like seasonal parties and arranges group discounts to other events.  Participation in community and charitable events. ** Please note: Eligibility for benefits offered is based on employment status **TENANT SUPPORT WORKER:($56,796.64 - $65,740.30 Annually)Position SummaryReporting to the assigned supervisor, the Tenant Support Worker works with tenants to provide emotional support, develop skills and access resources to increase their capacity to be successful and satisfied in the living, working, learning, and/or social environments of their choice. He/she/they provides these services directly or facilitates and coordinates access to services available on the site and in the community. The position establishes positive working relationships with a diverse tenant population from various socioeconomic backgrounds and supports with overcoming challenges living in a social housing environment. The role also works with various internal teams and external community partners to resolve potential issues, coordinate opportunities, and facilitate changes that increase the chances of successful tenancies.CANDIDATE PROFILEThe successful candidate will have the following:EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Diploma in community social service, health care delivery, community mental health, or other relevant fields.  Considerable experience in direct supportive counselling with diverse populations that face multiple barriers to successful housing.  Or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience acceptable to the employer. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Sound knowledge of current social issues such as poverty, homelessness, mental illness, addictions, domestic violence, child protection, etc.  Sound knowledge of community resources and methods of access.  Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act and applicable Health and Safety regulations.  Ability to learn and understand BC Housing and social housing programs, and their role in the social service system.  Ability to learn and understand BC Housing programs, policies, and operational structure.  Ability to apply a high degree of discretion in establishing supportive, trusting relationships with tenants while respecting the role and obligations of property management staff according to the Residential Tenancy Act.  Ability to build relationships with internal and external clients.  Ability to assist groups to develop and co-ordinate community activities and programs.  Ability to build and maintain professional, confidential relationships with multi-barriered people.  Ability to work effectively across organizational departments and in a team and partnership context.  Strong analytical, problem-solving, and time management skills.  Strong awareness of cultural diversity.  Strong skills in crisis intervention, mediation, and conflict resolution.  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and basic computer systems  Valid Class 5 BC driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle  Please Note: Successful applicant(s) are subject to a satisfactory criminal record search and are required to maintain Security Clearance throughout their employment.  Due to the nature of this role, a valid class 5 driver's license and satisfactory driving record is required. You want to work with construction professionals who build quality single family homes, safely, with both the community and the homeowners’ best interests in mind.You willDeliver on company values such as Teamwork, Results and PassionEnsure momentum on the project is created and sustainedKnow how to drive results even when the chips are downCommunicate priorities with conviction and candorEmbrace the Anthem WayWhat you'll doAssume overall responsibility for all on-site construction activities for the homes under your supervisionMaintain constant communications with senior management, inspectors and all applicable officials related to the ongoing construction of the projectEnsure all work is performed by contractors and suppliers to contract documents (including drawings, specifications and contract scopes of work)Review all project plans, specifications, applicable documentation and report any omissions or discrepancies directly to the Construction ManagerReview and maintain the construction schedule and ensure that all contractors and suppliers comply with the critical dates they are required to meetTake full responsibility to ensure that all Municipal inspections, professional inspections, occupancy permits, and possession dates have been achieved to the satisfaction of the construction managerAssume direct responsibility to ensure the quality of construction, products and finishing are meet or exceed Anthem standardsMonitor and enforce all Anthem Safety rules and regulations as they relate to AB OH&S Legislation to ensure a safe jobsiteYou haveProven experience leading and directing all field personnelA thorough understanding of the entire construction process - preferably with exposure to wood frame construction and single family homesExcellent verbal and written communication skillsThe ability to get things doneWe haveGreat, diverse, authentic people!Unlimited career growth opportunitiesMentorship from the ‘best in the biz’Corporate Giving Strategy supporting community developmentAnnual salary reviews and performance bonuses100% employer paid Benefit Plan with Healthcare Spending Account and Employee Assistance ProgramEducational Assistance Program‘Dress for your day’ policy… and more!Safety First. Always. We’re proud our in-house Construction team is COR Certified. Our talented 100+ team members will forever shape neighbourhoods and cities across Alberta, B.C. and Sacramento. Safely.Anthem is a real estate development, investment and management company that strives, solves and evolves to create better spaces and stronger communities. We are Growing Places.We work hard. We work smart. We work in teams. We challenge the status quo and have fun doing it. We believe in developing our people to maximize their potential. Conversations are candid, conflict is swiftly resolved, and coaching is continuous.Founded in 1991, Anthem is a team of 450 people driven by creativity, passion and direct communication. Anthem has invested in, developed or managed – alone or in partnership – more than 310 residential, commercial and retail projects across western North America. Our growing residential portfolio includes 17,500 homes that are complete, in design or under construction, from master planned mixed use residential and multifamily, to townhome and single family communities. We own, co-own, manage or have previously owned over 8.5 million square feet of retail, industrial, residential rental and office space. We have developed more than 60 communities across 7,400 acres of land in Alberta, British Columbia and California.Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies. a valid Ontario Driver’s License and have access to own transportationEquity, Diversity and Inclusion StatementThe York Region District School Board (YRDSB) believes in giving each and every applicant an equal opportunity to succeed on their own merit and we strive to hire staff that reflect and support the diverse perspectives, experiences and needs of students and communities. We remain committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our living, learning and work environments. We know that diversity underpins excellence, and that we all share responsibility for creating an equitable, diverse and inclusive Board-community.Therefore, in pursuit of the Board’s values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across the organizational hierarchy in actualizing the Board’s priorities, goals and principles outlined in the Director’s Action Plan. Candidates who have strong racial literacy practices and a commitment to dismantling anti-racism, anti-oppression, and creating identity-affirming spaces, in order to intentionally disrupt racist and hateful acts.We Actively Encourage Applications From Members Of Groups With Historical And/or Current Barriers To Sovereignty, Equity, Including, But Not Limited ToFirst Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples, and all other Indigenous peoples;African, Black and Black Caribbean peoples (in alignment with Anti-Black Racism Strategy);South Asian, East Asian, Southeast Asian, Middle East/West Asian, Latino/Hispanic (in alignment with YRDSB Workforce Census to address disproportionalities identified).members of groups that commonly experience discrimination due to race, ancestry, colour, religion and/or spiritual beliefs, or place of origin;persons with visible and/or invisible (physical and/or mental) disabilities;persons who identify as women; andpersons of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities, and gender expressions.At YRDSB, we recognize that many of these identities intersect and therefore, equity, diversity and inclusion can be complex. We value and respect the contributions that each person brings to enriching the Board and are committed to ensuring full and equal participation for all in the communities that we serve.Accessibility and Accommodation StatementWe also recognize the duty to accommodate and foster a culture of inclusion. Consistent with the principles of dignity, individualization and inclusion, we will make any appropriate accommodation based on any of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code to support candidate participation in the hiring process. When contacted, candidates will be provided with an overview of the various elements of the hiring process, such as skills assessments, written practicum, presentation, interview, etc. If an accommodation is required, requests can be made in advance of any stage of the recruitment process. All information received relating to a candidate’s required accommodation will be addressed confidentially by the Recruitment and Retention Team. Please make this request to careers@yrdsb.ca or a member of the Recruitment Team. If this position is a school based LTO/Contract Teaching position, please email the Principal directly to request the accommodation to be made at the school in collaboration with Human Resource Services, Disability Management Team.Important Note for YRDSB Employees: If you have a current accommodation in place through Disability Management, please inform your Disability Management Case Manager to ensure that your accommodation needs can be met in the new role that you are pursuing. If invited to participate in the hiring process, and you are unable to perform the essential/bona fide requirements (e.g. physical, cognitive requirements), please notify the Recruitment Team by emailing careers@yrdsb.ca to review next steps (in the email please reference the job title you are applying to).Important Information For CUPE 1734 MembersLA.11.7 Those twelve (12) month employees filling vacancies as a result of their applying to a job posting are to remain twelve (12) months at their position. Ten (10) month employees are to remain in their position until the end of the school year. This requirement can be waived with permission from the Superintendent responsible for Human Resource Services. This does not prevent employees from applying for a position or from applying for a promotion during the twelve (12) month period.On-line applications are collected centrally at the Education Centre - Aurora and are monitored by Human Resource Services. All applications will be screened based on the required education, experience and qualifications as noted in the posting and job description and as reflected in the application. Only those candidates meeting these criteria will be eligible to participate in the selection process and only qualified candidates will be contacted.The personnel file of all internal applicants will be reviewed as part of the selection process.

Park Paving Ltd. has been locally owned and operated for almost 50 years as one of the largest road construction contractors in Edmonton, and we are looking for an BASE CREW FOREMAN to work with our company's Base division for the upcoming 2024 road construction season.This is a seasonal position that offers competitive wage with benefits. This includes the use of a company truck to and from work, and for all other company business.The primary duties for this position will include, but are not limited to:Placement and construction of gravel road base structuresMeasure and order materials for daily requirementsMaintain time and material records necessary to complete daily job costingDirectly supervise, educate, and train employeesEnsure a safe work environment in compliance with all safety policies and proceduresAdhere to all company policies and provincial regulations for safe working procedures and environmentPerform daily field level hazard assessments in compliance with company policiesAbility to discuss and plan daily project procedures/goals with fellow personnel to maximize productivity and workmanshipCheck to make sure that equipment functions properlyAny labour or equipment operator tasks normally associated with road constructionRequirementsAll successful candidates must:Have an understanding of the construction industry and road construction specifications and standardsMust be able to check grade and efficientlyDisplay a professional and courteous approach with co-workers, supervisors, and the publicMust be physically fit – repetitive bending, lifting, kneeling, walking for long periods of timeBe able to work in inclement weather, heat and humidity, and exposure to dust and asphaltPunctual and able to work full time, overtime, and weekendsAbility to run grader, loader, skid-steer, and packing equipmentSuccessful candidates will also possess the interpersonal skills needed to take direction and coordinate their efforts with their crew and foremen, while maintaining a positive and respectful work environment. Successful candidates will also be able to maintain a *safety-minded* and *high accountability* work culture while working with their direct supervisors, and other employees while maintaining a positive and respectful work environment. Successful candidates must have a driving record free of major infractions, and must pass a medical/fitness exam, as conditions of employment. ***Pay Scale $37 - $44#PPLMP

Job DescriptionSpecialist, Multi-Residential DesignHuman Services – Peel Housing Corporation Status: 1 Contract Full Time up to 13 MonthsSalary Range: $76,054 to $95,068 per annum (plus comprehensive benefits, where applicable)Work Mode: Hybrid * see below for more details about this work mode. Location: 7120 Hurontario St., MississaugaHours of Work: 35 hours per weekWho we are: Peel Housing Corporation provides safe, well maintained living environments for tenants in Peel Living and Region of Peel owned properties including: 71 residential properties, two transitional housing residences and three emergency shelters. These services contribute to a positive experience for residents and enhance neighbourhoods where the buildings are located.In this role you will be responsible for supporting execution of projects for common area and in-suite renovation and other state of good repair related Capital Works within the Peel Living portfolio. As a member of the Peel Housing Corporation (O/A Peel Living) Infrastructure and Planning Services team. As the Specialist, you will provide technical expertise/guidance and oversee work including supporting the Project Manager in execution of projects, design development, specification and standards development, contract administration and construction inspection.What You Will Do In This RoleTechnical, Design and Specification preparation and Construction Inspection: Develops design concepts and associated presentation materials based on research & resolution of technical/ design issues.  Develops construction documents for projects of varying scope with minimal supervision.  Modifies and update designs based on review comments from senior staff.  Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters.  Prepares architectural drawings using REVIT, AutoCAD, SketchUp and other modeling software for various projects including in-suite and common area renovations / retrofit and other state of good repair work.  Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules.  Preparation of contract documents / scoping and integration with Engineering drawings as necessary.  Supports execution of technical design assignments in a timely manner.  Supports Senior staff with effective analysis of applicable building codes, by-laws and other regulations and technical documents / reports to which a project may be subject.  Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. What The Role Requires Post-secondary diploma/degree/certificate in an architectural or design program or a combination of education and experience may be considered  Minimum 3 years’ experience in the fields of Interior Design, Architecture, or construction and working with various building trades, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.  Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. Nice To Have Ability to become OAA member/licensed Architect or Technologist or a Registered Interior designer with ARIDO would be considered an asset.  National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. Perks @ Peel and why you will love working for us: Comprehensive Health, Dental, Vision benefit plan including psychological health (effective start date)  Automatic enrolment into OMERS pension plan (where applicable)  Accrue Vacation on a monthly basis (where applicable) up to 3 weeks per annum  3 Paid personal days and floating holidays  Flexible hours supporting your wellness and wellbeing  Annual performance review and merit increases based on performance (where applicable)  Supportive leadership and a culture of respect and inclusion  Access to tuition reimbursement (where applicable) and learning and development resources Work Mode & Job Location:  In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario St., Mississaugaworksite. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario. The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.  Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.Kindly ensure to regularly monitor your spam and junk email folders, as important communications regarding your application may be directed there.If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.About UsPeel Region consists of the cities of Brampton and Mississauga, and the town of Caledon. Peel Region delivers essential services to more than 1.5 million residents and approximately 175,000 businesses.We’re working to create a community that is safe, inclusive, and accessible. A place where everyone feels they belong and can access the services they need to thrive throughout each stage of life.Our workforce is 6,700 strong and s ince 1974, we’ve been delivering a wide range of resident focused services. Our services include paramedic services, health programs, long-term care and services for seniors, child care support, garbage collection and recycling, waste water and water treatment, road maintenance, financial assistance, and housing support.Recognized by Canada's Healthy Workplace Month® with the  Great Employer Award  presented by Excellence Canada, Peel Region is a place where everyone feels they belong. We strive to develop a workplace that values and respects diversity, practices inclusion, recognizes the unique contributions and abilities of all people and facilitates innovative thinking. At Peel Region, people come first. Each employee has an important role within our community and when we work together, it’s impactful. We encourage you to join us in delivering essential services and programs to our diverse community. You won't find a better opportunity than Peel Region.Additional InformationPeel Region is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.Peel Region is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.caPlease be advised, Peel Region uses email to communicate with applicants for open job competitions and does not use AI technology in any part of the recruitment process. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e., testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

OTT Properties & Development Group, a member company of OTT Financial Group, is a fast-growing developer converting OTT's vast land reserves in Ontario into commercial, residential, and industrial properties.OTT Financial Group is the parent organization of a group of financial services and investment companies. Detailed Visualization: Utilize CAD software like Revit and 3ds Max to produce detailed drawings, models, and renderings. Proficiency in different software including CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit), Sketchup, Adobe Creative Suite, and other related software. Knowledge of appropriate legislation including Occupational Health & Safety Act and Employment Standards Above average technology skills (Outlook, MS Word, Excel, Project Management software, Text, Email) Excellent verbal and written communication skills, which are important in performing many of their duties, such as relaying information, preparing reports, and interacting with members of the organization. Able to collaborate appropriately with build-team members and management. Able to act with integrity, credibility, self-confidence, take initiative, be self-directed, and prioritize work. This is not a hybrid or remote position. The Federation of Canadian Municipalities (FCM) is the national voice of municipal governments, representing the interests of cities and communities with the federal government.Position Lead, Buildings Department Growth & Development - Green Municipal Fund (GMF) - Programs Classification  Level 7 SalaryOur salaries generally range from $98,000 - $110,000 and are based on qualifications and experienceLanguages English required, French is an asset Term Permanent Full-Time Location Hybrid (Ottawa)/Remote (Canada)Why GMF is the place for youAt GMF, we empower our people to create change where it has the most impact – municipalities. GMF is a $1.6 billion permanent endowment from the Government of Canada, managed at arm's length, making it nimble and available for higher-risk, higher-impact initiatives. A further $530M investment into GMF to support the National Adaptation Strategy was announced in November 2022. Our team is committed to helping local governments switch to sustainable practices faster. GMF is the cornerstone program of the Federation of Canadian Municipalities (FCM).Our unique mix of funding, resources, and training gives municipalities the tools they need to build resiliency — and create better lives for Canadians. Through GMF, municipalities have reduced carbon emissions; built better transportation assets; constructed efficient and resilient buildings; diverted waste from landfill; made previously unusable land available for development; and improved soil and water quality.You in this roleAs an active member of the FCM Green Municipal Fund (GMF) Programs team, the Lead, Buildings will support FCM’s overall role as a national leading municipal association and will promote the adoption of climate change solutions in the sector. The Lead will be responsible for the strategic leadership and direction of the Community Building Retrofit (CBR) Program and additional programming at GMF supporting energy efficient and resilient buildings. Reporting to the Director, Net Zero Acceleration Proggrams, the Lead will also take a leadership role in updating the GMF ’s strategy for the buildings sector, balancing the needs of the FCM’s diverse stakeholders and developing a pathway towards optimal environmental, social and economic benefits for Canadian communities. As part of their role, the Lead will ensure that the work GMF does in the sector aligns with and advances GMF’s strategic objectives. The Lead will also be responsible for developing the network and funding approaches and supporting knowledge and mobilization tools to support transformation of the sector towards more sustainable practices.The work at FCM includes FCM becoming an even more member-driven organization that balances the realization of its goals with a people-centered approach. The incumbent embodies FCM’s commitment to being a healthy, diverse, inclusive, and anti-racist organization. As a member of the team, the Lead, Buildings works in a manner that embraces these values, the corporate culture and the passion for FCM’s mandate.What you’ll be doingWill serve as GMF's Buildings lead. Responsible for the GMF’s funding offers for community and municipal buildings which includes ensuring the offers remain current and meet the needs of Canadian municipalities Responsible for developing GMF's sector intelligence, roadmaps and performing due diligence on potential solutions for the sector. Maintains up to date knowledge and data on trends and opportunities for low carbon, resilient buildings in Canada and globally and keeps the broader GMF team informed. Supports Capacity Development (CD) in development of mobilization materials such as business cases and procurement tools, and online materials to support municipalities in adoption of emerging solutions. Engages with municipalities to provide direction and advice for their specific circumstance Supports outreach in assessing new applications, advising for success and pro-actively seeks new funding opportunities that address energy sector priorities. Pro-actively looks for multi-community risk-sharing and partnering opportunities to accelerate results and replication in the sector and identifies opportunities for large commercialization partners/investors to support broad mobilization of solutions. Establish and maintain strong relationship with key stakeholders and sector organizationsDevelop strategic partnerships with other organizations for the delivery of sector initiatives Provide expertise to inform FCM energy advocacy priorities Represent FCM in conferences, events, webinars, meetings, including with senior officialsRepresent energy sector work and direction at GMF Council.Your skills make us betterEducationYou bring:Engineering degree and 7-10 years of experience or other relevant combination of education and experience.Certifications such as Certified Energy Manager (CEM) and LEED credentials considered an asset. ExperienceExperience developing the business case and economic models for new building and building retrofit projects an asset.Experience assessing climate change impacts on buildings and integrating climate change resiliency into building design.Experience assessing the financial impacts of climate change on building stock and knowledge of financial mechanisms to increase the resilience of existing buildings to climate change impacts.Experience providing technical and economic due diligence for procurement, investment or project finance of retrofit and new building projects.Municipal sector experience in advancing adoption of sustainable technologies and practices. Experience in economic modeling and cost sensitivity analysis.Technology and sector road mapping experience. Public and private sector experience. KnowledgeKnowledge of deep retrofit strategies for buildings.Demonstrated knowledge of building science and sustainability for residential, municipal and commercial buildings.Strong understanding of emerging clean technology trends and environmental solutions CompetenciesPitching, presenting, proposing and getting new build and retrofit projects approved Strong analytical and communications skills. The ability to communicate in written and verbal format in both official languages is an asset. Why working here rocks We Prioritize Work-life Balance With Our Flexible ModelWhen we say flexible work model, we mean that in collaboration with your manager and based on what your team needs, you have the flexibility to determine when you work so that you can enjoy a healthy balance between work and personal demands.While you do need to live in Canada for this role, you can primarily work from home. Travel may be required to Head Office in Ottawa periodically. The majority of the GMF team operates from the National Capital Region.We do like to visit the areas we are impacting and it allows us to see unique and wonderful parts of our country. You may find yourself traveling nationally 10-15% of the time. We don’t just talk about employee wellness, we live it:  Summer hours between July 1 and Labour Day:7-hour workdays rather than 7.5Every Friday off in the summerFlexible work arrangements to support productivity and well-beingCommitment to employee developmentCompetitive range of employee benefits and servicesOffice facilities located in the Byward Market and Ottawa’s downtown coreWe’re committed to fostering an organizational culture that embraces equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging, where individuals from diverse racial and ethnic identities, nationalities, social economic status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression and physical and mental abilities can thrive and be fully engaged at their best level.We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.How To ApplyIf this role speaks to you and the impact you want to make, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today.The deadline to apply is March 27th, 2024.The future of work here includes a hybrid work model; therefore, this role will be a combination of virtual and on-site work.The successful candidate is required to live in and be authorized to work in Canada. They are also required to be able to work from home/remotely, from within Canada. All in-office work and in-person meetings for work that take place inside and/or outside of the offices located in Ottawa will be subject to FCM’s Safe Workplace Vaccination Policy, as well as its health and safety procedures.For additional information on this posting, or for further information on FCM, access our website at www.fcm.ca. Learn more about the Green Municipal Fund at https://greenmunicipalfund.ca/

Position OverviewConstruction Ontario trains with the future in mind. We deliver supportive and innovative recruitment solutions for small, medium, and large construction employers. In addition, we help Ontarians find jobs in construction with diverse companies across Ontario.Our member is seeking a highly organized and experienced Custom Home Project Manager to join their dynamic team. As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire lifecycle of custom home builds, from initial client consultation to project completion. Collaborating closely with an Assistant Supervisor, you will play a crucial role in coordinating trades, managing schedules, and ensuring the successful execution of high-quality custom home projects.Key ResponsibilitiesClient Interaction:Conduct initial client consultations to understand their vision, preferences, and specific requirements.Establish and maintain strong client relationships throughout the project, providing regular updates and addressing concerns or inquiries promptly.Project Planning:Develop comprehensive project plans outlining timelines, milestones, and critical path activities.Collaborate with the design team to ensure accurate interpretation and implementation of client specifications.Budgeting and Pricing:Gather pricing information from suppliers, subcontractors, and other relevant sources to develop accurate project cost estimates.Monitor and manage project budgets, identifying and addressing any cost overruns.Trade Coordination:Collaborate with subcontractors and trade professionals to ensure seamless coordination of work.Negotiate contracts and agreements with subcontractors, ensuring competitive pricing and adherence to project timelines.Scheduling and Logistics:Develop and maintain a detailed project schedule, coordinating activities and resources efficiently.Oversee logistics, including material deliveries, equipment rentals, and site preparations.Quality Control:Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the highest standards of workmanship.Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress and address any issues promptly.Team Leadership:Work closely with the Assistant Supervisor to delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively.Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to team members, fostering a collaborative and results-driven work environment. Qualifications:Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management, specifically in custom home building.Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering high-quality custom home projects on time and within budget.Strong knowledge of construction processes, building codes, and industry best practices.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, subcontractors, and team members.Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills.Proficient in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite.If you are a motivated and experienced Custom Home Project Manager with a passion for delivering exceptional results, we invite you to apply and contribute to our partner’s growing success in the custom home building industry.

Job DescriptionPotvin Construction Company, a renowned leader in the construction industry for over four decades, invites you to join our esteemed team. With expertise spanning across Interior Trim, Exterior Siding, Cabinetry, and Framing divisions, we are committed to delivering excellence in craftsmanship and service.Overview:As a working Foreman you will be responsible for leading, supervising, and motivating a small crew of construction workers in the Framing division. You will be working from one of our residential construction sites in Ottawa, playing a pivotal role in overseeing and participating in the residential division. Your leadership and expertise will be instrumental in ensuring the quality, efficiency, and safety of our framing operations.Primary responsibilities:Lead and coordinate employees and subcontractors, actively participating in framing activities. Ensure quality installation through thorough inspection and hands-on involvement. Provide project planning and management support, overseeing the framing division's tasks and schedules. Participate in safety and incident investigations and reviews, maintaining a safe working environment. Assist project coordinator in reviewing and updating construction schedules, offering insights from on-site experiences. Ensure all workers receive necessary training, offering guidance and mentorship as a working foreman. Attend weekly and quarterly production meetings, providing input on framing progress and challenges faced on-site. Qualifications:Proven track record in employee supervision, showcasing strong leadership abilities. Positive attitude coupled with a customer-centric mindset. Extensive experience in carpentry and framing, ensuring high-quality workmanship. Exceptional organizational skills for efficient task management. Proficiency in problem-solving and troubleshooting, resolving challenges effectively. Ability to thrive under pressure in fast-paced environments. Professional demeanor. Self-motivated, responsible, and committed to delivering excellence through hard work. Bilingual proficiency is considered an asset. Benefits:Dental careExtended health careLife insurancePaid time offCasual dress codeCompany eventsOn-site parkingJoin us where your leadership and expertise will contribute to our continued success in delivering top-notch construction solutions. Apply today to be part of our longstanding legacy of excellence in the industry.Company DescriptionPotvin Construction, family owned local business, has been a leader in the Ottawa construction industry. For over 40 years, we’ve specialized in providing quality products, expert craftsmanship and reliable customer service to both residential and commercial builders. Specializing in framing, siding, interior trim and cabinets.Potvin Construction, family owned local business, has been a leader in the Ottawa construction industry. For over 40 years, we’ve specialized in providing quality products, expert craftsmanship and reliable customer service to both residential and commercial builders. Chez Caméléon RH, nous croyons au bonheur au travail et ceci passe essentiellement par un bon jumelage entre le bon rôle, la bonne entreprise, le bon patron et l’environnement qui sera stimulant pour vous! Nous sommes là pour vous écouter, vous comprendre et connaître la personne derrière le curriculum vitae. Nous nous engageons à vous présenter des offres qui vous permettront de vous épanouir et de vous réaliser en tant que professionnel, mais aussi en tant qu’individu.Êtes-vous prêt pour l’aventure Caméléon? Notre expertise, vos couleurs!Location :  Laurentides / Lanaudière / Montréal / Laval.Type d’emploi :  Le poste est permanent temps plein, soir, nuit et fin de semaine.Ton environnement de travail :Notre client est une entreprise dynamique et flexible en pleine expansion qui offre un service de qualité. Tu travailleras dans un environnement collaboratif qui encourage la communication ouverte et qui est très dynamique et qui encourage l’innovation, l’amélioration continue et les nouvelles idées.Ton quotidien, en quelques lignes :Le rôle de linstallateur de chantiers routiers est d’installer et désinstaller les équipements de signalisation sur les chantiers routiers (panneaux de signalisation, barils, etc.), d’effectuer le chargement et le déchargement du matériel de signalisation, de déplacer des remorques flèches et tout autre équipement de sécurité en veillant à la sécurité des usagers de la route, des citoyens et de ses coéquipiers.L’emploi exige de soulever des charges à répétition (charges allant jusqu’à 50lbs.), et de travailler dans diverses conditions météorologiques.La petite liste des indispensables :Carte d’installation de la signalisation de chantiers routiers AQTR STC-101. Nous offrons cette formation! Permis de conduire classe 5 valide;  Bonne lecture de plan de signalisation;  Bonne forme physique (capable de soulever des charges de 50+lbs à répétition); Vigilance, courtoisie, autonomie, initiative, patience, sens de l’observation, communication. Bonnes raisons pour postuler :4 semaines de vacances; fermé entre Noël et Jour de l’an; Assurances collectives offertes et possibilité de participer à un RVER; Poste qui offrira beaucoup d’autonomie et de latitude.

Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Notre culture et ADN sauront vous exprimer la reconnaissance de votre travail, vos talents et vos compétencesPoste permanents : 36h présence/télétravail avec horaire flexible. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The company is joined by top-tier, global venture funds and angel investors.Role:We are seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive the product strategy at Parallelz. Compliance and Security:Ensure the playable ads solution adheres to data security and privacy regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant standardsWork with the engineering team to implement robust security measures to safeguard user dataRequirementsUnderstanding within the mobile apps or mobile games ecosystems5+ years of experience in product management inside of a mobile app or platform ecosystem2+ years in leadership position as a part of, or reporting to a senior leadership positionExperience in a fast pace, early-stage startup environmentDemonstrated success in driving product strategy, roadmaps, and delivering products to marketStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-makingAbility to product plan and evaluate trade-offs in order to define priorities, communicate them upwards, and put together comprehensive product plansBonus: Understanding of ads ecosystemBonus: Software development background or experience leading an engineering teamsBonus: Resides in the Toronto regionBenefitsThis is a full-time remote position. We offer a competitive salary, benefits, and an Employee Stock Option Plan.

Provides feedback to ensure that the proper corrections are made to the those drawings in respect to divisional design requirements if required;Coordinate fixture program with visual team;Validation of the location and square footage of new store locations with Leasing;Coordinate and group together all viable information received from the field and any external consultants required to finalize the outline (Surveys);Communicate with Landlords to ensure all base building drawings, design criteria, and all other relative information needed is acquired to prepare a preliminary scope of work and outline drawing.
