Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

Job Description: Valard Construction LP is Canada's premier powerline contractor, serving clients in both public & private sectors. We offer construction services in overhead and underground transmission and distribution systems, substations, fibre optics, as well as substation and transmission foundations.Valard Construction LP is looking to hire a Transmission & Distribution Estimator who will be responsible for compiling cost estimates to a client or potential client with products or services primarily for overhead distribution and transmission lines. He or she will do this by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. The best price isn't always the lowest one, and clients now award contracts based on quality of the service offered, as well as cost.RequirementsDuties and ResponsibilitiesAssemble estimates from various sources into a complete and final estimate for the company with Engineering support as requiredDevelop an understanding of indirect and conceptual estimating techniques and theoriesReview and validate outsourced estimates with support from engineerReview and incorporate historical data from estimates received, contracts awarded by the EPC Contractor and final actual project costs into Valard's cost modelFormat estimates in Owners Reporting formatReviewing and understanding of the Design Basis, Engineering Design Documents, and Basis of EstimateDevelops complete estimates on selected projects consisting of project site visit, quantity take-off, pricing, and presentation of the estimate for cost engineering and management reviewProvide estimating input on complex "conceptual" transmission projectsProvide guidance for non-estimating personnel on their estimating related requirementsAttend and assist in project planning sessions and team meetings to provide estimating inputInterface and communicate effectively (written and oral) with the estimating team, with all levels of management, clients and industry contacts; contacts and develops business relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimatesDevelop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics; including, when required, construction and work procedures for specific activities related to a bidDevelop or assist in the development of preliminary project schedulesPerform additional assignments per supervisor's directionKnowledge/ Skills:Experience in estimating, cost control, construction management and/or engineering with estimating experience in projects ranging from $0.5M to $25MUnderstanding of construction documents and the ability to assess the level of completenessHas developed technical knowledge of estimating practices, techniques and equipmentAccurate data input and calculating skillsKnowledge of construction costs and budgets, ability to develop a project scheduleSolid computer skills; Proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Project and ExcelAble to read drawings and specificationsThe ability to work in a team environmentAbility to validate proposals, manage multiple priorities and work under pressure with minimal supervisionAbility to identify problems/issues, looks beyond the immediate problem to the wider implications and generates possible solutionsVerifiable work references demonstrating exceptional skills and achievements including:A high level of professionalism; Dependable, results-focused and ethicalStrong organizational, multi-tasking and planning skillsStrong customer serviceStrong verbal and written communication skillsCapable of adapting information/style to the audience, explains difficult information clearly and influences and persuades others towards consensus agreement in straightforward situationsEDUCATION B.Sc. degree in Engineering, Bachelor of Commerce Degree (BCom), Construction Management Certificate, or equivalent combination of relevant experience and educationBenefitsValard Construction LP is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary and a complete range of employee benefits.We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' education and experience best meets the needs of the position. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

sourcing or in-store improvement programs.What You’ll Do:Consolidate key store data from all geographical regions, including North America, EMEA and Asia-Pacific in a consistent cadence and manner.Collaborate with broader store development team to create department wide templates for effective tracking & monitoring of project development.Support department in regular publications of key store data and provide management with latest updates and development.Act as the brand guardian with regards to data integrity and accuracy and promote the importance of store data analytics to all regions.Support leadership in the development and establishment of necessary monitoring and governance framework, while offering analysis of key store data to identify value engineering and streamline opportunities.Work with internal IT and Analytics team to create department relevant dashboards and reports to promote data driven coordination and decision-making processes.Collaborate with Visual Merchandising, Operations, and other relevant internal stakeholders to create operational standards and facilitate effective store development processes.Act as the Store Development representative and lead the coordination of cross-functional operating initiatives, such as global vendor sourcing or regional in-store improvement programs.Lead and facilitate multi-store improvement programs in partnership with regional store development team to ensure effective and efficient deployment i.e. new store fixtures.Let’s Talk About You:Degree in Architecture, Project Management, Construction Management, or related fieldsMinimum 10 years of experience in luxury retail projectsPrevious International project management experienceProficiency in industrial-related software such as, MS Office, MS Projects, Adobe, etc.Exposure to working with data-analytic platforms such as Tableau and Power BIAdvanced Excel skills with the ability to create concise master databases effectively and efficientlyStrong understanding of the complete store development process, from concept to completion, with a solid understanding of regional & international nuances in retail store projectsAnalytical mindset to be able to sort, organize, manipulate, and rationalize different types of dataExperience working in multi-disciplinary teams and environments, and able to mediate and prioritize different objectives to align on common goalsProven experience in vendor selection and evaluation processesA team player who is detail- oriented, motivated, and driven to succeed with good business acumenCreative and innovative problem solver with excellent time management and coordination skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills, bonus points for multi-lingualHighly adaptable and able to work within both mature and start-up environmentsWorking Conditions:Hybrid work environment10-20% travel required annually Additional InformationWhat’s in it For You?A company built on Canadian roots and heritageYour work is recognized with a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards ProgramOpportunities for career growth through numerous internal and external programsRecognize and be recognized by your peers with our Goose Rewards & ICON RewardsBe a part of CG Gives. We believe every one of our team members enriches our diversity by exposing us to varying ways to understand the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design, produce, and deliver great products and service. SBM is seeking a Structural Engineer, Project Lead in our Structural Small Buildings Division in our Kitchener office.The Candidate will be responsible for assisting with structural analysis and design for a variety of building types, including single-family and multi-residential dwellings (included in Part 9 of the OBC). This candidate will work as the Project Lead and with other engineers, engineering trainees, and technologists to complete structural analysis and designs for new and existing buildings/components, as well as assisting with development and review of drawing packages. They will be required to seal their own work, as well as that of designers under their direction. Field work, including structure evaluation and/or construction review, will also be required.Company Summary:SBM is an established multi-disciplinary Planning, Civil, Structural, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering firm that utilizes a team first, collaborative approach to building engineering. We are a fast growing, energetic company that encourages personal growth and forward thinking. We are looking to add like-minded individuals to our team. SBM has offices in London and Kitchener, providing engineering services to a variety of private and public sector clients across Southwestern Ontario. The firm employs over 120 engineers, engineering trainees, technologists, technicians, planners, and administrative personnel.Key Responsibilities:Become familiar with design guidelines, standards, and regulations associated with structural engineering (specifically wood frame construction)Preparation of structural engineering design and documents ensuring accuracy, adequacy, and conformance to the design requirementsSet up AutoCAD drawings as per the company’s standardPrepare AutoCAD drawings from sketches, mark-ups and/or designManage project tasks within assigned time and budget constraintsMaintain familiarity with current techniques, codes, and standards to sustain and improve technical skillsAssist in researching new systems, resources, analytical processes, procedures and working practices to identify and implement changes to increase efficiency, productivity, and overall profitabilityCoordinate with other team members on various projects at the same time to achieve project milestonesAccept technical guidance from colleagues or senior staffWork within the project team environment from preliminary stages of the design through to completionCoordinate structural aspects of projects with other discipline designs and drawingsWhen required, complete site investigations, general reviews of construction, and preparation of field review reportsOther tasks as assigned by Senior Engineers/Techs, Team Lead or Division ManagerSkills / Qualifications:Bachelor’s in Structural Engineering from an accredited Canadian University or equivalent requiredRegistered as a licensed Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) with the Professional Engineers of Ontario required4+ years of experience in Structural Engineering related to design of buildings Knowledge of OBC (specifically part 9)Experience with wood frame constructionAbility to communicate with clients and coworkers effectivelyProficient with AutoCAD and the Microsoft Office 365 Suite (Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Teams); Experience with Woodworks considered an assetStrong knowledge of construction materials and practices or construction work experience considered an assetAbility to coordinate multiple projects and work in a fast-paced environment and manage competing prioritiesAbility to work both independently with little supervision and in a team environmentCommitment to ongoing professional and personal growth; willingness to learnExcellent attention to detailAccess to vehicle for site review/inspectionsCompensation:This is a full-time position with a competitive salary and annual performance bonus. SBM offers a positive working environment and a good relationship with our employees which translates directly to better customer service and a superior finished product for our clients. The successful candidate will typically work 8am-5pm Monday-Thursday and 8am-2:30pm on Fridays.What We Offer:Health Benefits PlanRRSP Matching (4%) ProgramPaid OvertimePerformance BonusesBanked Time OptionsRegular Social and Team Buildings EventsOpportunity to build great relationshipsCareer Growth and DevelopmentPaid VacationTo Apply:All qualified applicants should apply through our online application system.References are to be made available upon our request.SBM is an equal opportunity employer. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment in accordance with relevant governing laws. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Date Posted: Feb 28, 2024Posting Close Date: None.Powered by JazzHR1PMaWVaJtx

Architectural Sales ManagerCGC Inc. is a leading marketer, manufacturer and distributor of gypsum wallboard products, interior finishing material and suspended acoustical ceilings. With locations around the world, CGC and USG have the resources, plants, products, and people to build walls, ceilings, and careers.CGC Inc. is currently recruiting an Architectural Sales Manager for our corporate Ceilings Sales Department, based in Oakville, ON; Montreal, QC; Calgary, AB; or Vancouver, BC.It's a permanent and full-time position, offering a challenging opportunity for a motivated individual to demonstrate their sales and technical abilities within a large corporation.Position SummaryThis position has overall responsibility for managing the CGC relationship with the Architectural and General Contractor community in Canada. architecture and general contractor support between Architectural, Ceilings and Gypsum Division.· Maintain high level relationships at key members of the construction team, including owner representatives, architects, general contractors, construction managers, subcontractors and distributors.· Implement and lead sales strategies to attain specification parity with competition.Business and Market Knowledge· Fully understands CGC and USG’s critical challenges and leads the effort to address them while leveraging CGC and USG’s competitive strengths.· Leverages a broad array of company and industry informational resources to address key business issues.· Accurately summarizes business and financial data, and consistently applies that information.· Chooses the course of action that targets the most critical issues and has the greatest impact on the business.· Takes clear and decisive action in high-stakes situations and crisis, and conditions of uncertainty.· Creates a climate supportive of candid communication and collaboration.· Proactively solicits diverse perspectives and leverages them to build best practices.· Attends to and demonstrates understanding of key pieces of complex spoken information, extracts relevant information from presentations on highly complicated topics.· Accurately anticipates customer needs and proactively meets/exceeds expectations and requirements of external and internal customers.· Promotes the rules of ethical conduct in interactions with others, follows through on commitments.Qualifications:· Demonstrated leadership and organizational skills.· Results oriented, proven track record of data driven success.· Strong interpersonal and communication skills· Experience within the building materials/architectural/construction community.Education· Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field.Years of Experience· Five (5) to ten (10) years of functional experience in Management, Sales, or similar functional area.Required Skills· Good understanding of customer dynamics in the Architectural or Construction community· Able to work through ambiguity.· Cross-functional understanding of CGC and USG businesses and functions.· Experience as a People Leader.· Participation in cross functional task forces or teams.What We OfferCGC offers competitive base salaries and cash incentive awards, comprehensive benefits, and financial protection for employees and their families. Our Employee Group Benefits Plan (extended health care and dental care) begins on your first day of work!· Extended health care (including prescription drugs, vision, and paramedical professional services)· Dental care (includes both preventative care and major dental work)· Short-term and long-term disability· Life insurance· Retirement plan- contributory defined benefit plan· Investment plan- defined contribution plan with options to contribute to a Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) and/or a non-registered savings plan.· Incentive Plan- cash payments based on target achievement are earned quarterly or annually, depending upon the plan.· Vacation time- between four and seven weeks paid vacation based on length of continuous service.· Employee Assistance Program (EAP)· Wellness Program offers fitness club memberships at a special reduced rate, health coaching, nutrition support, smoking cessation services, and much more.· Rewards and Recognition ProgramWe understand the importance of balancing work and your personal life and will help you make your best contribution in both.At CGC Inc. we go the distance to provide The Better Way. Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. QualificationsDiplôme universitaire ou DEC en design d’intérieurMinimum de 2 ans d’expériencesMembre de l’APDIQMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)Maîtrise du logiciel Autodesk Revit®, suite Microsoft Office et Enscape3DConnaissances du cadre législatif et réglementaire en matière de construction (ex. : CCQ, CNBC)Formation ou accréditation LEED ou WELLÊtre méthodique et soucieux de la qualité du travailFaire preuve d’autonomie, de polyvalence et de créativitéEsprit ouvert, positif et collaboratif Informations complémentairesContribuer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et attentionnée. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Notre culture et ADN sauront vous exprimer la reconnaissance de votre travail, vos talents et vos compétencesPoste permanents : 36h présence/télétravail avec horaire flexible. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. Job Description: Valard Construction LP is Canada's premier powerline contractor, serving clients in both public & private sectors. We offer construction services in overhead and underground transmission and distribution systems, substations, fibre optics, as well as substation and transmission foundations.Valard Construction LP is looking to hire a Transmission & Distribution Estimator who will be responsible for compiling cost estimates to a client or potential client with products or services primarily for overhead distribution and transmission lines. He or she will do this by working out how much a project is likely to cost and create budgets accordingly. The job involves assessing material, labour and equipment required and analysing different quotes from sub-contractors and suppliers.An estimator might work from a bill of quantities or just a set of drawings from the client. Estimators provide prices for everything from a one-off scheme to maintenance projects which will be completed over several years.An estimator is concerned with getting the best price that will win the contract in a competitive bidding situation, while ensuring that the contract can be carried out profitably. The best price isn't always the lowest one, and clients now award contracts based on quality of the service offered, as well as cost.RequirementsDuties and ResponsibilitiesAssemble estimates from various sources into a complete and final estimate for the company with Engineering support as requiredDevelop an understanding of indirect and conceptual estimating techniques and theoriesReview and validate outsourced estimates with support from engineerReview and incorporate historical data from estimates received, contracts awarded by the EPC Contractor and final actual project costs into Valard's cost modelFormat estimates in Owners Reporting formatReviewing and understanding of the Design Basis, Engineering Design Documents, and Basis of EstimateDevelops complete estimates on selected projects consisting of project site visit, quantity take-off, pricing, and presentation of the estimate for cost engineering and management reviewProvide estimating input on complex "conceptual" transmission projectsProvide guidance for non-estimating personnel on their estimating related requirementsAttend and assist in project planning sessions and team meetings to provide estimating inputInterface and communicate effectively (written and oral) with the estimating team, with all levels of management, clients and industry contacts; contacts and develops business relationships with subcontractors and suppliers for pricing within estimatesDevelop or assist in the development of general and project specific plans for execution, sequencing, and logistics; including, when required, construction and work procedures for specific activities related to a bidDevelop or assist in the development of preliminary project schedulesPerform additional assignments per supervisor's directionKnowledge/ Skills:Experience in estimating, cost control, construction management and/or engineering with estimating experience in projects ranging from $0.5M to $25MUnderstanding of construction documents and the ability to assess the level of completenessHas developed technical knowledge of estimating practices, techniques and equipmentAccurate data input and calculating skillsKnowledge of construction costs and budgets, ability to develop a project scheduleSolid computer skills; Proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook, Project and ExcelAble to read drawings and specificationsThe ability to work in a team environmentAbility to validate proposals, manage multiple priorities and work under pressure with minimal supervisionAbility to identify problems/issues, looks beyond the immediate problem to the wider implications and generates possible solutionsVerifiable work references demonstrating exceptional skills and achievements including:A high level of professionalism; Dependable, results-focused and ethicalStrong organizational, multi-tasking and planning skillsStrong customer serviceStrong verbal and written communication skillsCapable of adapting information/style to the audience, explains difficult information clearly and influences and persuades others towards consensus agreement in straightforward situationsEDUCATION B.Sc. degree in Engineering, Bachelor of Commerce Degree (BCom), Construction Management Certificate, or equivalent combination of relevant experience and educationBenefitsValard Construction LP is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse workforce. Wellness programs including physical fitness, programs to help employees quit smoking, free flu shots, mental health resources, and lunch-and-learn lectures and seminars.  Recognition programs including long-term service awards, idea recognition and outstanding performance awards. An active Social Club that organizes special events like seasonal parties and arranges group discounts to other events. The position establishes positive working relationships with a diverse tenant population from various socioeconomic backgrounds and supports with overcoming challenges living in a social housing environment. Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act and applicable Health and Safety regulations. Ability to learn and understand BC Housing programs, policies, and operational structure. Ability to build relationships with internal and external clients.  Ability to assist groups to develop and co-ordinate community activities and programs. Company:    Southbridge Health Care LPLocation:     Ontario Region (Head Office - Cambridge)Position:      Project Manager – Permanent Full-timePosition DescriptionSouthbridge is looking for an experienced Project Manager for long-term care redevelopment and Capex projects. The successful candidate will oversee the planning, implementation and tracking of long-term care redevelopment and Capex projects. The successful candidate must possess the knowledge, experience, and confidence to engage and professionally interact with design professionals and consultants, while successfully directing construction related personnel in planning, coordinating and safely executing work in accordance with contract documents, schedule and budget. The successful candidate must be professional and a personable leader, dedicated to bringing in projects on time and on budget.As Project Manager, you’ll work as team member, managing multiple projects at various stages of development. Opportunities will include managing all aspects of Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care, municipal and code approvals. You will also manage schedules, budgets, design, drawings and specifications for each project.ResponsibilitiesThe Project Manager performs a wide range of duties including but not limited to all the following:Define the scope of the project in collaboration with the Vice President of Development Create a detailed work plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project Determine resources required to complete the project Develop a schedule for project completion that effectively allocates resources to activities Review project schedule with senior management and all other staff that will be affected by the project activities; revise the schedule as required Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion Work with internal team and hired designers/consultants to establish initial design, specification accuracy, drawing and tender accuracy Assess and contract qualified consultants and engineers to work on the project as appropriate Execute the project according to the project plan Document project activities Monitor the progress of the project and adjust as necessary to ensure successful completion on time and on budget Review the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets Southbridge standards Write reports on the project for management Monitor and approve all budgeted project expenditures Manage all project funds according to established accounting policies and procedures Ensure that all financial records for the project are up to date Ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase QualificationsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesKnowledge of project management methodology and tools Proficiency in the use of software for scheduling, budgeting, MS Office Personal characteristicsThe successful candidate should be able to demonstrate competence in all of the following:Behave Ethically: Understand ethical behavior and business practices, and ensure that own behavior and the behavior of others is consistent with these standards and aligns with the values of Southbridge. Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques. Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the project and to create new opportunities. Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness. Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of Southbridge. Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of Southbridge. Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals and track details/data/information/activities. Plan: Determine strategies to move the project forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans and evaluate the process and results. Solve Problems: Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem. Experience5 to 10 years in project management construction, planning and management experience Working ConditionsProject Managers usually work in an office environment, but the purpose of the project may sometimes take them to non-standard workplaces including travel for regularly scheduled site meetings. Project Managers work a standard work week but may be required to work some evenings and weekends to meet project milestones. If invited to participate in the hiring process, and you are unable to perform the essential/bona fide requirements (e.g. physical, cognitive requirements), please notify the Recruitment Team by emailing careers@yrdsb.ca to review next steps (in the email please reference the job title you are applying to).Important Information For CUPE 1734 MembersLA.11.7 Those twelve (12) month employees filling vacancies as a result of their applying to a job posting are to remain twelve (12) months at their position. Ten (10) month employees are to remain in their position until the end of the school year. Evaluate, select and apply standard architectural techniques, procedures and criteria using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.  Write reports and specification covering architectural matters. Support Senior staff and other stakeholders with evaluating site conditions and constraints, setting up and co-ordinating project schedules. Inspect construction, renovation work routinely and ensure that the work is being carried out in accordance with the Contract Specification and requirements.  Prepare detailed inspection reports identifying progress of work, issues, actions to resolve issues, deficiencies in work by contractor etc.  Monitor, analyze and make recommendations for design and construction contracts. Asset Management Support capital projects and budget planning by providing technical recommendations for in-suite assets and common area assets.  Review and research of emerging products, technologies and strategies.  Support and ensure that upgrades, improvements of assets are properly documented for warranty, maintenance and replacement/repair. Customer Service And Support Effectively communicate within Peel Living, its tenant and vendors, other departments and the public in a professional manner.  Provide general training on the use of building systems to site staff.  Solve problems, resolve conflicts, respond with tact and diplomacy. Have or working toward a valid Building Code Identification Number (BCIN) registration.  Working knowledge of relevant legislation ie. RTA, HSA, OBC, OFC  Computer literacy including data management and analysis  Demonstrated understanding of how property management services support successful tenancies  Experience working on multi-residential projects is considered an asset.  Experience in the tendering and budgetary process.  Experience with construction contract and specification writing is considered an asset. Skills/Abilities Experience working at multiple locations with competing priorities.  Excellent communication skills both oral and written.  Demonstrated ability communicating with audiences both internal and external.  Demonstrating supportive behaviour in a team environment with the ability to work independently.  Strong problem solving skills customer service skills that are client centered focus.  Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion through continuous development, modeling inclusive behaviors, and proactively managing bias. National Council of Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ) is considered an asset. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario. Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Industry Category: Retail Art Supplies, Design Services, and Movies, Videos, and Sound
Job Description: TITLE: Designer (Intermediate or Senior, based on experience)REPORTS TO: Head of Design, Engineering and TechnologyCompany OverviewFor over 20 years, Envision has been at the forefront of innovative thinking and ground-breaking ideas by integrating design, delivery and technology solutions for many of the best-known brands. Our unique service offering enables us to seamlessly integrate design and technology into built concepts that enhance the way people connect and interact with their environment, creating memorable user interactions and experiences.As a team, we continuously seek new and innovative ways to grow our business. Our agile, high energy culture rewards top performance and the contributions of those passionate about our collective growth and success. We are incredibly proud of the team we have built and are looking for like-minded individuals to help us in our growth trajectory.Summary Of PositionEnvision is hiring an experienced Designer to join our progressive team. The primary role of the Designer is deliver outstanding retail and environmental design solutions for existing and new client business opportunities, reporting to the Account Manager for each project and in collaboration with other departments such as project management, technology and production. The successful candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment and is confident expressing creative opinions and technical detailing drawings. They will also be able to articulate design rationales to clients to assist in delivering final project solutions.ROLE & RESPONSIBILITY Create compelling design solutions to serve the needs of existing clients, new business relationships and RFP submissions. Own the complete design process from ideation to implementation, working either independently or collectively with the rest of the design team Mentor junior design team in the creation of retail fixtures, environments, signage and displays. Provide clear and concise written and verbal communication to clients, suppliers and the design team – from strategy and concept presentations to team guidance and instruction. Work with Production, Technology and Engineering teams to develop concept drawings into manufacturable designs, providing technical drawings for quoting where required. Provide quality assurance on creative and physical deliverables. Perform with equal enthusiasm and creative input for both client-related and internal design tasks Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skills.Qualifications Post-Secondary Degree or College Diploma in Industrial Design, Interior Design, Architecture, or similar creative studies Interdisciplinary Studies or equivalent 7+ years’ experience as a proven hands-on design professional, preferably working on retail fixtures and environments A portfolio that demonstrates experience with various aspects of Industrial Design, Fixture Design, Environmental Design, and Retail Design work within an established design/branding firm or in-house studio (including but not limited to conceptual design, design intent drawings, engineering drawings, etc.) A portfolio that demonstrates a balanced blend of creative talent and technical understanding (create fresh, exciting concepts while having an understanding—even at a basic level—of the hardware, technologies, fabrication, and finishes required to bring those concepts into fruition) Strong conceptual thinking, including the ability to present ideas and concepts to others An understanding of, and design experience in integrating digital into fixtures and environments would be highly valued. Compelling design skills to visualize ideas in both 2D and 3D Expertise in 3D software such as Solidworks, Rhino, SketchUp, Keyshot and Twinmotion Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite Literate in Microsoft Office UI/UX knowledge would be considered an asset. Strong attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills Can effectively work in multifaceted team environments as well as being able to complete tasks independently A professional standard of excellence in all aspects of work, communications, administration, and relationships. A sincere appetite to learn more about the unique industry that Envision serves and a willingness to be challenged Any post education role related training would be an advantage Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively lead a team that aligns with Envision's core values of a progressive, balanced and positive working environment. A valid Ontario Driver’s license is requiredWhat We Offer Competitive compensation. RRSP match. Participation in the annual performance bonus program. Excellent benefits program. Hybrid remote/in office working arrangements Summer hours as per company policy. Three weeks’ vacation upon start. Sick days. A friendly work environment

Company DescriptionArcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.Job DescriptionAt Arcadis, our Transit Facilities Design professionals thrive on solving problems by putting their logic and creativity together. They are able to invent, explore, and question to enhance the areas around us. As a member of our Team, you will have the opportunity to work on unique and leading-edge projects with a local and international focus.You’ll have the opportunity to work with a fast-paced, driven team with a proven success record in both design and technical excellence!We are looking for a Project Coordinator with previous experience working as a project coordinator or junior project manager on transit projects or projects with large, multidisciplinary teams. The successful candidate will hold a degree in Architecture or Engineering and have a minimum of 5 years of experience, will have strong written and verbal communication and organizational skills, with an ability to think quickly to resolve problems in real time, and will also have a holistic understanding of the project delivery process.Role Responsibilities:As a Project Coordinator in the transit studio, your role accountabilities will include: Assist with the coordination, management, monitor and reporting of project milestones.Integrate and coordinate with all disciplines as required to complete project tasks.Liaise with extensive teams of consultants and contractors.Develop and maintain logs, registers and other tables for tracking purposes.Liaise with document control and assist disciplines with document submissions including quality checks process.Coordinate meetings, agendas and minutes.Requirement to work from a project office (currently in downtown Toronto).QualificationsQualifications and Experience:Minimum University Bachelor’s Degree; in Architecture or Engineering.Must have at least 5 years of proven work experience as a Project Coordinator in the Architecture or Engineering industry.Previous experience working on large and complex engineering or architecture projects from concept to delivery – P3 experience is an asset.Previous experience with interpreting and developing project scheduling, plans, managing budget and risks including document and quality control.Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple deadlines and work under pressure is expected.Previous experience with Primavera or similar project scheduling software is an asset.Proficiency MS Excel and other Microsoft applications such as Word, Powerpoint, Outlook.Proficiency Acrobat or Bluebeam for document mark-ups and comments.Proficiency with FTP, Project Wise, SharePoint, ISO, MS Office. PM+ experience is an assetModerate experience in Revit, Microstation and AutoCAD in order to navigate and identify file content is an asset.Strong communication and presentation skills – both written and verbal.Additional InformationWe can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life, and the world around you.Together, we can create a lasting legacy.Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging:As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex, and sexual orientation.We request applicants submit a RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. For design related roles, we also require a portfolio to review.We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.As part of Arcadis selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer (as applicable under state law). These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence, drug testing and driver’s license record.Join Arcadis. Create a legacy.

About Sweat And TonicSweat and Tonic (S&T) is Toronto's most innovative and exciting boutique fitness and wellness hub, offering the widest collection of expertly programmed Yoga, Pilates, HIIT, and Ride group fitness classes in Canada. We create a curated, immersive fitness experience for sweat enthusiasts to challenge their minds and bodies within a community that grows, succeeds, and celebrates together. With premium spa facilities, high-tech biohacking amenities, café, and bar offerings, members can recharge, recover, and reignite. Tonic House, the multi-functional lounge, workspace, and event venue, inspires collaboration and innovation. Since opening in 2019, we've innovated and expanded our state-of-the art classes across multiple channels: In-studio, Sweat in the Park, Sweat Live, Sweat on Demand, and Sweat on the Roof – a one-of-a-kind, outdoor rooftop fitness studio in the heart of downtown Toronto. In 2023, we opened our first international sister location, Silver Springs, a boutique yoga and Pilates oasis in the heart of Los Angeles, and a new 25,000 sq.ft. immersive fitness & wellness hub in Toronto at The Well. Zehr Construction (ZC), the construction division of Zehr Group, is looking for an Estimator/Pre-Construction Coordinator to join our growing team. In your capacity as an Estimator/ Pre-Construction Coordinator, you will be responsible for the day-to-day Estimating and/or Pre-Construction of various Projects as assigned.What We Are Looking ForA motivated, self-starter with a drive to learn new skills.An enthusiastic, team-player with a basic understanding of the construction industry An organized individual with excellent verbal and written communication skillsA recent graduate of a construction related diploma or degree program with 2-3 years experience. Task Description Assist the Estimating and Pre-Construction team on various construction projects. Conduct detailed bid document reviews to understand the full extent of work and which sub-contractors will be involved.  Conduct a detailed review of preliminary bid documents during the early Pre-Construction phases to identify the extent of work required, determine possible constructability and access concerns, and comment on the schedule/ sequencing feasibility. Complete a wide variety of quantity take-offs as required for preparing bids. Create bid forms and detailed scopes of work for all subcontractors. Ensure all subcontractor scopes of work are properly coordinated for seamless integration. Review all received subcontractor quotes and summarize them on bid levelling sheets. Have a keen eye for catching subcontractor exclusions and potential risks that may require scope gap allowances. Review bid documents for Estimating and Pre-Construction to identify discrepancies and comment on possible constructability concerns and/or risks that should be identified.  Regularly communicate with sub-trades during active bidding and budgets to ensure proper coverage. Manage all subcontractor requests for information (RFI’s) and communicate with applicable consultants as necessary to obtain answers.  Develop and maintain relationships with regular subcontractors and consultants.  Assist with the preparation of project budgets and estimate summary sheets. Participate in the tasks required on a high-energy closing day of a lump sum bid submission. Assist with Pre-Construction administration including preparation of site logistics plans, bidding schedules, and meeting minutes. Assist with the preparation of Zehr Construction proposals in response to RFPs for new projects.  Engage in Owner, Consultant and Subcontractor meetings as required. Other duties, as required.What We Offer An exciting opportunity to work on various construction projects including residential, commercial, and institutional projects. A chance to be involved with new construction and renovation projects. Experience with the Construction industry, including exposure to our other divisions, in Development and Property Management. A casual work environment with experienced industry professionals. An opportunity to train and use Procore – World’s Leading Construction Management Software Competitive wage and mileage/work expenses  For further information on our team and projects visit our website: http://zehrgroup.ca/ The successful candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office products including: Outlook, Project, Excel, and Word. It is not mandatory, but a general understanding of Procore construction software would be beneficial. Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid monthly for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved.Compensation will be based on experience, education, and performance. Expenses will be paid on a monthly basis for car mileage in accordance with Canada Revenue Agency regulations. Other related work expenses are to be approved. The regular office hours are from Monday to Friday. Compensation is based on a 44-hour work week. The successful candidate will be entitled to participate in any and all of the Company’s group insurance plans and any other benefit programs (the “Employee Benefits”) which may be in effect for all employees of the Company during employment.Company DescriptionThe Zehr Group is one of the fastest-growing real estate development and construction companies in South-Western Ontario. It currently has various condominium developments underway in the downtown Kitchener core. Zehr Group has completed over 300 construction projects including new commercial, residential, and industrial buildings, in addition to historical renovations. Landmark construction projects in the Region include Charlie West, Glove Box, 100 Victoria towers, The Breithaupt Block, and many more.

Description de l'entrepriseL’équipe d’A2DESIGN rassemble une variété de talents, depuis 30 ans. Nous formons un groupe uni par son audace, son ouverture et sa capacité à innover. Notre objectif : concevoir des environnements uniques qui reflètent véritablement l’ADN de nos clients. Plaçant l’humain au cœur de chaque projet, nous misons sur une approche globale qui combine engagement, agilité, collaboration et efficience. Nous sommes créateurs d’harmonie, concepteurs d’espaces de vie pensés pour le bien-vivre, la communauté, l’environnement et l’avenir.Description du posteParticiper aux relevés des besoins, des lieux, des mobiliers et procéder à la mise à jour des plans. Participer au développement des aménagements, des dessins conceptuels des espaces (3D_ Revit® & Enscape3D), des dessins d’ébénisterie et des dessins techniques de construction et devis. Participer à des études de potentialité, faisabilité et des estimations de coûts des projets. Rechercher et sélectionner les produits, les matériaux et préparer les colorations. Rechercher et sélectionner le mobilier, habillement de fenêtre et accessoires. Appliquer la réglementation au projet. Participer à la surveillance des travaux durant la construction et réviser les dessins d’atelier, addendas ou directives. Participer aux réunions de développement de projets. QualificationsDiplôme universitaire ou DEC en design d’intérieurMinimum de 2 ans d’expériencesMembre de l’APDIQMaîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé et écrit)Maîtrise du logiciel Autodesk Revit®, suite Microsoft Office et Enscape3DConnaissances du cadre législatif et réglementaire en matière de construction (ex. : CCQ, CNBC)Formation ou accréditation LEED ou WELLÊtre méthodique et soucieux de la qualité du travailFaire preuve d’autonomie, de polyvalence et de créativitéEsprit ouvert, positif et collaboratif Informations complémentairesContribuer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et attentionnée. Nos clients fidèles nous mandatent avec confiance afin de développer des projets de complexes immobiliers, d’espaces corporatifs (siège social) ou commerciaux (secteur médical privé, concessionnaire, commerces ou restaurants). Des réalisations où efficience et créativité vont de pair.Développer votre plein potentiel et votre carrière.  Vous aurez l’opportunité de contribuer à divers types de projets, ainsi répondre à vos ambitions professionnelles et ainsi profiter d’un équilibre personnel et professionnel.Nous vous accompagnons dans vos ambitions, objectifs de carrière, vos formations et accréditations professionnelles. Une expertise nourrie par l’expérience, le savoir-faire et la synergie et la collaboration d’équipe. Notre culture et ADN sauront vous exprimer la reconnaissance de votre travail, vos talents et vos compétencesPoste permanents : 36h présence/télétravail avec horaire flexible. Job Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. Company DescriptionWho we are:At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. Provides feedback to ensure that the proper corrections are made to the those drawings in respect to divisional design requirements if required;Coordinate fixture program with visual team;Validation of the location and square footage of new store locations with Leasing;Coordinate and group together all viable information received from the field and any external consultants required to finalize the outline (Surveys);Communicate with Landlords to ensure all base building drawings, design criteria, and all other relative information needed is acquired to prepare a preliminary scope of work and outline drawing. This position required to communicate with 3rd party (landlords, engineers, etc.) across Canada.Additional InformationWhat we offer (Why work with us):Hybrid work environment; A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only);Paid Time Off ( Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only);Additional benefits include annual bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement;50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Penningtons, Reitmans & RW&CO.);Generous Employee Referral Policy.If this inspires you…let’s talk. Parallelz enables developers and their existing mobile apps/games, without any SDKs, code changes, or engineering efforts to instantly improve user acquisition, organic virality, new revenue channels, and user experiences and capabilities that were not possible before.With Parallelz, users can access mobile apps instantly, with lossless quality, at full performance, on any desktop or mobile device. The Parallelz platform enables this by transforming existing native mobile apps into fully-native web apps, in real-time, that can be instantly accessible on any browser. Developers can now have a new frictionless way to reach their customers, free from the restrictions and taxations of the existing app stores.Parallelz unlocks millions of existing native mobile apps from their silos and transforms them into a more powerful and valuable asset that is fully web-native. Parallelz’ novel architecture creates a new category of building blocks for the web, enabling mobile apps and their functionality to become a new type of web primitive. This enables mobile apps and their discrete components, functionality, and data to instantly become directly addressable, configurable, and compositable. Furthermore, this enables entirely new types of dynamically personalized, user and ML-generated, synthetic app experiences.Our company is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications -- ways that were never thought possible. We allow developers to – with no modifications to their code – transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled garden app store.But this technology doesn’t just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users, giving them more control over their mobile device experience. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our team to help guide our product towards our strategic goals.Our founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Mozilla, MIT, and former founders of high-growth venture-backed startups. The company is joined by top-tier, global venture funds and angel investors.Role:We are seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive the product strategy at Parallelz. Your responsibilities will include customer development, requirements synthesis, and product strategy.Key Responsibilities:Product Strategy and Vision:Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and stay ahead of industry trendsCollaborate with stakeholders to develop a product roadmap that addresses customer needs and business objectivesTechnical Expertise:Possess an understanding of the mobile app ecosystems, mobile ad tech, and mobile data science and analytics to effectively communicate and guide engineering teamsTranslate high-level technical requirements into actionable tasks for the engineering team, ensuring successful implementation of the playable ads solutionStay updated with the latest advancements in mobile technology, emerging platforms, and machine learning to ensure the product stays competitive and cutting-edgeProduct Development:Lead the end-to-end product development process, from ideation to launch, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of features and enhancementsWork closely with senior leadership and other functions to bring the product to market successfullyDefine key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics, continually monitor the product's performance, and drive continuous improvementsCollaboration and Communication:Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders and effectively communicate the product strategy, progress, and outcomesConduct regular product updates and presentations to internal teams and external partnersBonus - Compliance and Security:Ensure the playable ads solution adheres to data security and privacy regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant standardsWork with the engineering team to implement robust security measures to safeguard user dataRequirementsUnderstanding within the mobile apps or mobile games ecosystems5+ years of experience in product management inside of a mobile app or platform ecosystem2+ years in leadership position as a part of, or reporting to a senior leadership positionExperience in a fast pace, early-stage startup environmentDemonstrated success in driving product strategy, roadmaps, and delivering products to marketStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-makingAbility to product plan and evaluate trade-offs in order to define priorities, communicate them upwards, and put together comprehensive product plansBonus: Understanding of ads ecosystemBonus: Software development background or experience leading an engineering teamsBonus: Resides in the Toronto regionBenefitsThis is a full-time remote position. Established in 1989, Terlin has become a leader and innovator in full-service construction for retail, commercial, and institutional clients. Distinguished by their end-to-end approach and unparalleled reputation for quality and reliability, Terlin’s state-of- the-art facility houses their custom Millwork shop which provides an exclusive focus on the specialized needs of their clients. From design through construction and service, Terlin handles every aspect of interior construction and delivers outstanding and consistent results.The Terlin Team is a talented and driven group of experts, tradespeople, designers, and project managers. In addition to their skilled partners and sub-trades, Terlin’s complete team is made up of close to 200 dedicated individuals – each committed to making customer service and satisfaction their highest priorities. And they are always looking for great people to join their team!The OpportunityTerlin is currently searching for a full-time, experienced, and dynamic Senior Project Manager with retail, institutional, commercial, and institutional construction experience to join our team. The environment is fast-paced and growth-oriented – ideally suited for individuals who like to take charge and are driven to build on current successes.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Project Manager, you will be responsible for building business success by identifying, qualifying, establishing, planning, implementing, maintaining, and coordinating retail/ ICI construction projects within the decided-upon budget, timeline, and scope. The functions include business development, cost estimation, organizing and planning, as well as preparing close out and reporting documents, all while collaborating with sub-contractors and colleagues to ensure the successful delivery of projects.Specifically, the Project Manager will be responsible for:· Developing comprehensive project plans including schedules, budgets, and resource allocation.· Assembling, leading, and delegating to a team of professionals, including architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors.· Contract administration.· Managing project fees, invoicing, schedules, execution, deliverables, and the quality of the projects during design and construction.· Monitoring project budgets, tracking expenses, and making adjustments as needed to ensure projects stay within budgetary constraints.· Identification of risk and associated mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions and cost overruns.· Reviewing project documents (drawings, specifications, RFI’s, etc.) and evaluating the completeness for the respective phase of design and/or construction.· Implementing and enforcing quality control processes to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and client expectations.· Evaluating requested changes and managing the change process.· Project reporting and updating relevant stakeholders / team members on project progress.· Prioritizing and enforcing safety protocols to protect the well-being of all personnel on constructions sites.· Identifying business opportunities with current and prospective customers and by researching the industry and market trends.· Procuring and executing a portfolio of projects ranging from multiple small projects to major site improvements.· Collaborating with the Finance department as it relates to budgets, expenses, and profits as well as detecting cost-related issues.· Coaching and supporting project team members with assigned tasks.The successful candidate is a self-starter who possesses excellent communication skills, is extremely organized, detail-oriented, has a positive attitude and a vast knowledge of construction and trades.Qualifications· Minimum fifteen (15) years of construction industry project management involving retail and ICI works.· Base building construction experience.· Strong business acumen as it relates to full project management including conceptual / detailed estimating, scheduling, cost controls, reporting, and demonstrated ability to manage budgets and schedules within project expectations.· Ability to recognize issues as challenges and the capacity to work well under pressure.· Professional and diplomatic.· Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills are critical for managing and leading diverse cross-functional teams.· Ability and willingness to travel periodically.· Knowledge of Canadian Building Code.· Excellent time management and computer skills.· Ability to motivate, think outside the box when needed, and willingness to adapt to new concepts.· A valid Secret security clearance (or ability to successfully obtain same) is a requirement of the position.· Bilingual (English and French) would be considered an asset.· Proficiency in construction software (Procore) and scheduling tools (MS Project) would be considered a significant asset.· PMP Designation would be an asset.· A valid driver’s license is required.What Terlin Has to OfferTerlin offers employees the opportunity to work on innovative projects alongside dynamic, dedicated, and talented teams who possess a strong drive Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques. Creativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to improve operations of the project and to create new opportunities. Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness. Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of Southbridge. Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of Southbridge. Plan: Determine strategies to move the project forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans and evaluate the process and results. Experience5 to 10 years in project management construction, planning and management experience Working ConditionsProject Managers usually work in an office environment, but the purpose of the project may sometimes take them to non-standard workplaces including travel for regularly scheduled site meetings. About Sweat And TonicSweat and Tonic (S&T) is Toronto's most innovative and exciting boutique fitness and wellness hub, offering the widest collection of expertly programmed Yoga, Pilates, HIIT, and Ride group fitness classes in Canada. We create a curated, immersive fitness experience for sweat enthusiasts to challenge their minds and bodies within a community that grows, succeeds, and celebrates together. With premium spa facilities, high-tech biohacking amenities, café, and bar offerings, members can recharge, recover, and reignite. Tonic House, the multi-functional lounge, workspace, and event venue, inspires collaboration and innovation. Since opening in 2019, we've innovated and expanded our state-of-the art classes across multiple channels: In-studio, Sweat in the Park, Sweat Live, Sweat on Demand, and Sweat on the Roof – a one-of-a-kind, outdoor rooftop fitness studio in the heart of downtown Toronto. In 2023, we opened our first international sister location, Silver Springs, a boutique yoga and Pilates oasis in the heart of Los Angeles, and a new 25,000 sq.ft. immersive fitness & wellness hub in Toronto at The Well. This is a unique, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to become a part of a passionate, dynamic team that is here to disrupt the fitness industry.About The RoleWe are seeking a full-time Project Manager to support the expansion of the S&T brand to future locations in Toronto and beyond, and management of annual business initiatives within the organization. The ideal candidate is passionate about supporting teams to make progress, maintain clear communication, stay on schedule and budget, and remain organized through all phases of a project, specifically design and construction. They have extensive experience driving projects forward despite challenges, building and maintaining positive relationships, and an eagerness to thoroughly understand all aspects of S&T's offerings and operations. This full-time position will report to our Chief Brand Officer, work alongside our management team, and work directly with the design and construction consultant team to complete design, construction, coordination, and procurement projects for all future locations. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to merge their passions for Project Management, Design & Construction, and Fitness & Wellness, and get involved in the early stages of a growing organization.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesAct as the primary liaison between Sweat & Tonic and the consultant team during the design and construction of future club locationsProvide leadership and oversight of the project(s) assigned to you regarding scheduling, planning, cost management, quality management, and contractual obligationsPrepare RFPs, review bids and execute contracts for project consultants including Architect, Interior Designer, Structural Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, Electric Engineer, Acoustic Engineer, AV consultant, IT consultant and Security consultant. Reporting to the Director of Property Management, the Property Manager will oversee the daily management of a designated residential and commercial portfolio and ensure the implementation of the company's policies, procedures, and lease requirements.
